input: One of the nifty new features that debuted in Firefox 3.5 last week was support for the W3C Geolocation API Specification, a Web standard that can fake a GPS-like effect by using clues such as the Wi-Fi networks
continuation:
youre connected to and your IP address.

Now Mozilla has announced that it will be supporting this API in its upcoming Firefox 4.0 release, which is scheduled for release later this year. The company also plans to add support for geolocation services such as Google Maps, OpenStreetMap (OSM) and Foursquare at some point in the future.

Weve been working closely with the Geolocation Working Group over the past several months to make sure we are providing a great experience for our users, said Brendan Eich, Mozillas chief technology officer, in a statement. With Geolocation support in Firefox 4.0, we are giving our users more control over how their location data is used, while still protecting their privacy.

The Geolocation API allows developers to build applications that display information based on the users geographic location, such as where they are located, what time of day it is, and whether they are near or far from a specific place.

Geolocation APIs have been around since the early days of the Internet, but until now they were only available to developers who had access to

input: A new travel site called Rome2Rio launches today, the brainchild of two ex-Microsoft employees, Michael Cameron and Bernard Tschirren. The sites main innovation? Its vehicle agnostic, in a way
continuation:
that makes it easy for anyone to create their own itineraries.

Cameron, who worked at Microsoft for five years before leaving to start his own company, says he was inspired by an idea he heard about from a friend: What if you could create your own travel itinerary on the web?

So he set out to do just that, and has created a website where users can create their own trip itineraries, then share them with other travelers.

We want to make it as simple as possible for people to get started, Cameron told me. The idea is that you dont have to be a tour guide or a travel agent to use this tool. You just need to know how to use Google Maps.

The site works like this: A user uploads a photo (or video) of the place they want to visit, and the site automatically creates an itinerary based on the information provided. Users can also add their own photos and videos to the site.

Users can choose from a variety of options when creating their trips, such as whether they want to stay in a hotel, rent a car, or take public transportation.

input:
The salesman, showman and visionary who dreamed up the Indianapolis 500 would be proud: The 100th running this weekend will host the first official sellout and one of its largest crowds to date.
But "Crazy" Carl G. Fisher --
continuation:
who died in a plane crash at age 71 on Jan. 2, 1969 -- wouldn't have been surprised if he saw his dream come true.
Fisher was one of the most influential figures in Indianapolis Motor Speedway history.
He helped build the speedway into what it is today while also serving as an ambassador for IndyCar racing.
Fisher was inducted into the Motorsports Hall of Fame of America last year.
His legacy lives on through his son-in-law, Chip Ganassi, and his grandson, Graham Rahal.
"It's just incredible," Graham Rahal told NBC Sports. "I don't think I've ever seen anything like it. It's so cool to see how many people are coming out to watch the race."
Graham Rahal won the pole position for Sunday's 102nd running of the Indianapolis 500. He'll start from the front row along with Josef Newgarden, Will Power, Simon Pagenaud, Takuma Sato, Alexander Rossi and Sebastien Bourdais. (Photo by Michael Reaves/Getty Images) More
Rahal's father, Graham Sr., was a three-time Indianapolis 500 winner and two-time Formula One world champion. Graham Jr

input:
FILE - Libya's eastern-based commander Khalifa Haftar attends a security conference, in Benghazi, Libya, Oct. 14, 2017.
Eastern Libyan forces have reportedly taken control of the town of Gharyan, less than 100 kilometers from
continuation:
the capital Tripoli, according to local media reports.
Haftars self-styled Libyan National Army (LNA) launched an offensive against Tripoli on April 4, but has been unable to capture it so far.
The LNA is backed by Egypt and the United Arab Emirates as well as Russia.
Libya descended into chaos after the 2011 NATO-backed uprising that toppled and killed longtime dictator Moammar Gadhafi. A U.N.-brokered political agreement between rival administrations in the east and west of the country was agreed upon in 2015.
But since then, there have been multiple attempts at establishing a unified government, each time with little success.
Last Update: Wednesday, 15 October 2020 KSA 13:53 - GMT 10:53

input: As far as the authorities could tell, some of the younger members of the Fourth Reich Skinheads of Orange County had been hating Jews, blacks and other ethnic minorities for only less than a year. So maybe there was still time to reach them, offer
continuation:
them a chance at redemption.

But thats not what happened. Instead, they were gunned down in cold blood by a group of white supremacists who believed that skinheads should be able to do whatever they wanted with their lives  including killing Jews.

This is the story of how two young men from different worlds ended up on the wrong side of the law. Its also the story of how hate crimes have become an increasingly common part of our national conversation.

And its the story of how we can all work together to stop this from happening to anyone else.

On Nov. 11, 2016, James Alex Fields Jr. drove his car into a crowd of anti-fascist counterprotesters in Charlottesville, Va., killing 32-year-old Heather Heyer and injuring dozens more. The next day, he pleaded guilty to second-degree murder, three counts of aggravated malicious wounding and one count of leaving the scene of an accident involving death or serious injury.

In court, Fields apologized for his actions. I am truly sorry for my actions, he said, according to The New York Times.

He was sentenced to life in prison without the possibility

input: Whyallas Citizen of the Year Karen Harrison has urged everyone to consider nominating a worthy community member, group or event for next years Australia Day Awards. The City of Whyalla has extended nominations for the 2019 Australia Day awards to
continuation:
include groups and individuals who have made an outstanding contribution to the local community over the past 12 months.

Karen Harrison (pictured) is the Mayor of the City of Whyalla.

We want to hear from people who are making a difference in our community, whether it be through volunteering, fundraising or just giving back to the community, Ms Harrison said.

Australia Day is all about recognising the hard work that goes into making this country the great nation we know it to be. Its a day where we can come together to celebrate what makes our country so special.

I encourage everyone to get involved and nominate a deserving person or organisation for next years award.

Nominees must be nominated by someone who knows them personally, such as a neighbour, friend or family member. Nomination forms are available online at www.whyalla.wa.gov.au/australia-day-awards-nominations until midnight on Friday, December 13.

The 2019 Australia Day Awards will be held at the Whyalla Showgrounds on Sunday, January 5, 2020. For more information, please visit www

input: Students in the New Hartford Central School District and other area school districts are set to learn an old subject in a new way. Pretty soon, theyll tackle physics, and theyll do it with the speed and ease of the Internet
continuation:
.

The district is working on a pilot program that will allow students in grades 6-12 to take online courses at their own pace. The courses would be taught by certified teachers who have been trained to use the Web as a teaching tool.

We want to make sure that were doing everything we can to provide our students with the best possible learning experience, said Dr. John OBrien, superintendent of the New Hartford Central School District. This is a great opportunity for us to look at how we can better utilize technology to enhance student learning.

The district has already started the process of developing the course curriculum, which is expected to be completed this summer.

In addition to being able to take classes at their own pace, students will also have the ability to earn college credit through the states high school equivalency exam.

I think its going to be a very positive thing, OBrien said. Its going to give our students more options. Its going to give them a lot more flexibility when it comes to what they choose to do with their education.

input:
NOTTINGHAM  The sale of USA Springs property on Monday has been postponed for three months after the company filed for bankruptcy.
A representative from James St. James Auctioneers, of Manchester, which was scheduled to conduct the auction, confirmed company representatives
continuation:
will not be able to sell the property until at least July 1.
The company filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in Delaware last week.
We were hoping to get it done today, but we are just going to have to wait and see how things play out, said Chris Gaffney, a partner with the firm.
USA Springs is one of the largest producers of mineral water in the United States, according to its website. It produces more than 100 million gallons of spring water each year.
Gaffney declined to say how much the company owes, but he said they owe about $2.5 million. He added that the company is still owed money by other creditors.
I dont know what the exact amount is, but its a lot, he said. Its a big number. Were still working through it.
In a statement posted on its website, the company said the bankruptcy filing was due to unprecedented financial challenges brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic, as well as an inability to raise sufficient funds to continue operations.
This decision was made

BANKS FAVORED week-long term deposits this week, resulting in a sustained decline in yields for these papers despite an uptrend seen for longer tenors.
Offers for Wednesdays auction reached P60.829 billion
continuation:
, down from the previous weeks record high of P61.065 billion.
The weighted average rate (WAR) for one-week T-bills fell to 2.085 percent from 2.093 percent last week while the WAR for three-month bills dropped to 2.051 percent from 2.062 percent.
The weighted average rate (WAR) for six-month bills was unchanged at 2.076 percent from the previous week.
The weighted average rate (WAR) for one-year T-bills declined to 1.973 percent from 1.974 percent last week.
Meanwhile, the weighted average rate (WAR) for two-year T-bills edged up to 1.948 percent from 1.949 percent last week.
The weighted average rate (WAR) for five-year T-bills eased to 1.944 percent from 1.945 percent last week.
The weighted average rate (WAR) for seven-year T-bills increased to 1.962 percent from 1.961 percent last week.

input: The article below began by saying: "In a French comedy of, I think, the 16th century, there was a judge with a one-track mind, who kept asking the same question, 'Que diable allait-il faire en
continuation:
ce moment?' ("What devil would he make in this moment?")

This is not to say that God doesn't exist. It's simply to point out that it's not always possible to know what He will do in a given situation. Sometimes we don't even have a clear idea of what we're supposed to be doing or how we're supposed to be doing it.

I'm reminded of this when I read the following passage from the Gospel of Luke:

And Jesus answered and said unto them, If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me. For whoever will save his life shall lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake shall find it. (Luke 9:23-24)

There are two ways to look at this verse. One way is to see it as a warning against self-indulgence. The other way is to see it as a call to discipleship. In either case, it seems to me that Jesus is telling us something about our relationship with Him.

Let me give you an example of the second kind of reading.

A couple of weeks ago, I was driving home from work.

input:
Although final results are not expected until later, the scale of the predicted victory is such that the ruling Congress party has admitted defeat.
BJP leader Narendra Modi tweeted: "India has won. Good times ahead."
This is the most resounding
continuation:
election win for the BJP since it came to power in 2014.
The party's chief ministerial candidate Yogi Adityanath will be sworn in as Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister on Friday.
Mr Adityanath, who was born in Gorakhpur and studied at a government-run school in the city, had been tipped by some analysts to become the state's chief minister.
He is the first member of the Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) to become the chief minister of Uttar Pradesh, which is India's most populous state with more than 200 million people.
Image copyright Getty Images Image caption Yogi Adityanath (left) and Rahul Gandhi (right) were both seen as frontrunners for the top job
In his victory speech, Mr Adityanath thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for giving him this opportunity.
"I want to thank Prime Minister Narendra Modi ji for giving me this opportunity," he said.
"I want to tell all my brothers and sisters that if you work hard, you can achieve anything. I want to assure them that I am going to do my best to fulfil their expectations."
Mr Adityanath also paid tribute to former Prime Minister At

input:
High tide has passed in Cork city without flooding although a flood warning remains in place for part of the city centre during tomorrow morning's high tide.
The council says high tides and potentially high winds may cause flooding between 6am and 8am tomorrow morning
continuation:
.
Flooding is not expected to be as severe as it was earlier this week when parts of the city centre were inundated with more than two metres of water.
However, residents are being urged to check their properties before leaving for work or school.
Cork County Council has issued a number of flood warnings over the past few days which will remain in place until at least 7pm on Friday night.
A flood warning means that flooding is likely to occur and people should take action to protect themselves and their property.
These include moving valuables out of the way, keeping doors and windows closed and turning off utilities such as gas and electricity.
It comes after Storm Emma brought heavy rain and strong winds to parts of the country last week.
Met ireann has warned of further heavy rain and gales across Munster, Leinster and Connacht later today.
Gale force gusts of up to 70km/h have been recorded along the west coast of Ireland, while coastal areas could see gusts of up to 90km/h.
A Status Yellow wind warning has also been issued for parts of the south-west of the country including Galway, Mayo, Sligo, Donegal

input:
Jacksonville High School girls soccer coach John Mansholt will be coaching the MacMurray College mens soccer team this fall as well.
Mansholt is one of two new Highlander soccer coaches. MacMurray hired Andrew Len
continuation:
z, who was an assistant coach at Western Illinois University last season.
Lenz has been with MacMurray since 2015 and played for the school from 2007-10. He was a four-year letterwinner for the Hilltoppers and earned All-Conference honors in his senior year.
The other new MacMurray coach is Ryan OBrien, who comes to the program after spending the past three seasons as an assistant at Southern Illinois University Carbondale, where he helped the Salukis win their first-ever Missouri Valley Conference championship.
OBrien also spent time as a graduate assistant at SIU-Edwardsville during the 2017-18 season.
MacMurray opens its season on Aug. 30 against Southeast Missouri State. The season opener is scheduled for Sept. 3 at home against Loyola Marymount.

input: An activist of the Resistant Citizen, against the junta-backed constitution seals her mouth with duct tape and holds a placard reading ''7 Reasons To Not Accept Constitution'' during gathered to hold activities against the draft constitution, ahead of the August 7
continuation:
referendum in Naypyitaw, Myanmar, July 30, 2012. REUTERS/Soe Zeya Tun

YANGON (Reuters) - Myanmars military rulers will not be able to rewrite the countrys new constitution through a vote on Aug. 7 because they lack the two-thirds majority needed in parliament to pass it, an opposition lawmaker said on Tuesday.

The military government has refused to allow any public debate on the constitution, which was approved by a landslide in a June election won by Aung San Suu Kyis National League for Democracy (NLD) but which critics say does not reflect the countrys ethnic diversity.

I dont think there is any way the military can amend the constitution through a referendum, said Khaing Than Oo, a member of the NLDs constitutional drafting committee, speaking at a news conference in Yangon.

He added that if the military wanted to change the constitution, it would have to seek approval from the U.N. Security Council.

Myanmars army chief, Senior General Min Aung Hlaing, told lawmakers last week that the constitution

input:
The U.S. Army veteran and Clarksville-based Realtor is the first Democrat to enter the race to replace Congressman Mark Green.
Democrat Juanita Charles, a U.S. Army veteran and Clarksville-based Realt
continuation:
or, announced her candidacy for Tennessees 6th Congressional District on Tuesday.
Charles, who lives in Nashville, said she decided to run for Congress after seeing how divided the country has become since Donald Trump was elected president.
I think its time that we come together as a nation and start looking at what we need to do to move forward, Charles told The Tennessean. We have a lot of work to do.
Green announced he would not seek re-election earlier this year, citing health reasons. He is the first member of Congress to announce his retirement since the 2016 presidential election.
In a news release announcing her campaign, Charles said she wants to focus on issues like healthcare, education and climate change. She also said she wants to improve infrastructure across the district and create more opportunities for young people to get involved in politics.
I want to be an advocate for my community because I know what its like to live in a community that doesnt feel represented by our government, Charles said. I want to make sure that all voices are heard, especially those from communities of color and those with low incomes.

input:
Dedicating a Sunday in May to sharing the gospel of Jesus Christ through music is a long-standing tradition at Wheaton's Gary United Methodist Church.
On Sunday, May 20, during the 9 and 11 a.m. services, the
continuation:
church will hold its annual Gospel Singing Day.
The event, which was first held in 1998, has grown over the years and now draws hundreds of people from across the country and around the world.
"We've been doing it for so many years that I don't know if we'll ever get tired of it," said the Rev. John Kuehn, pastor of Wheaton's Gary United Methodist Church. "It's just such a wonderful thing to do. It's a great way to bring people together."
In addition to singing, there will also be food trucks on site, as well as a children's area with face painting, bounce houses and other activities.
There will also be a silent auction with items donated by local businesses and organizations.
"We're hoping to raise about $10,000 this year," Kuehn said. "I think it's going to be a lot of fun."
The event is open to anyone who wants to come and sing or participate in the various activities.
Kuehn said he would love to see as many people as possible show up for the event.
"I'd really like to see a big turnout," he said. "This is one of our

input: UNITED NATIONS, May 6 -- Answering a question about Iran on Thursday the UN Ambassador of Uganda, a member of the Security Council, said "we should not let the development of science makes nuclear weapons move faster than us, who are
continuation:
trying to stop it."

"We must be very careful that we don't give them an advantage in this area," he said.

He was speaking at a press conference organized by the United Nations Office for Disarmament Affairs (UNODA) and the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), which is charged with monitoring Iran's nuclear program and verifying its compliance with the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT).

The IAEA has reported that Iran has been enriching uranium up to 20 percent fissile purity, well above the 3.67 percent level permitted under the NPT.

In response to a question from a reporter, Mr. Mukhisa Kituyi, Permanent Representative of the Republic of Uganda to the United Nations, told reporters that the international community needs to work together to ensure that Iran does not develop nuclear weapons.

"We should not let the development of science make nuclear weapons move faster than us, who are trying to stop it," he said.

Mr. Kituyi also stressed the need for the international community to work together to prevent Iran from acquiring a nuclear weapon.

"We cannot allow Iran to become a nuclear power," he said

input: A glimmer of light is flickering at the end of a dark tunnel at Dundee, whose supporters' trust, Dee4Life, has co-ordinated a Company Voluntary Arrangement (CVA) to pull the Scottish First Division club
continuation:
out of administration.

The CVA will be put to shareholders at a meeting later this month and if approved, it would allow the club to stay in the top flight for another two seasons before being placed into liquidation.

Dee4Life chief executive David Ross said: "We have been working on this for some time and we are really pleased with the progress we have made so far.

"It's a huge relief for everyone involved that the club can now continue to play its part in the local community."

Dee4Life was set up last year by former Dundee United and Scotland striker Gary McAllister as an umbrella organisation to help the city's football clubs.

McAllister, who played more than 300 games for the Tannadice side between 1995 and 2003, has since become a director of the trust.

He added: "I'm delighted to see Dundee United back in the Premiership.

"It's a fantastic achievement for the fans and the club and I hope they can build on it next season."

Ross believes the CVA will provide a lifeline for the struggling club.

He added: "This is a very positive step forward

input: Every year, the MIT Sloan CIO Symposium names four finalists to its CIO Leadership Award. This year's list includes Cynthia Nustad, senior vice president and CIO at Health Management Systems, which provides government-funded, commercial and private
continuation:
health care services for more than 1 million people in New York City.

Health Management Systems (HMS) is a not-for-profit organization that has been serving the city of New York for more than 100 years. It was founded in 1891 by a group of doctors and nurses who wanted to improve the quality of life for their patients. Since then, it has grown to become one of the largest health systems in the country, with more than 10,000 employees and an annual operating budget of $3.5 billion.

"Cynthia has done a fantastic job leading HMS over the past few years," said Michael J. Littman, chairman and CEO of HMS. "We are proud to have her as part of our leadership team."

Nustad joined HMS in 2006 after serving as chief information officer at the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). She also served as executive director of the VA Information Technology Office from 2007 to 2010. In this role, she oversaw the implementation of the VAs Electronic Health Record (EHR) system.

"I am honored and humbled to be named a finalist for the CIO Leadership Award," said Nustad.

input: Virginia Tech coach Frank Beamer, whose Hokies (3-3, 1-1 ACC Conference) are one of only two Football Bowl Subdivision schools to go to bowl games each of the past 22 seasons, is the winningest active coach (
continuation:
247) in FBS history.

Beamer has won at least 10 games in seven of his 11 seasons as a head coach, including a school-record 12 last season. He also has won at least nine games four times and 10 or more times three times.

He is the first Virginia Tech coach to win 100 games since Bobby Bowden, who had a record of 102-48-2 from 1976-94.

Im just really proud of what weve been able to accomplish this year, Beamer said. We have a lot of young people on our football team. Were trying to build a program that can be successful for many years to come. Im very pleased with where we are right now.

The Hokies will play their third consecutive road game when they visit Wake Forest on Saturday. The Demon Deacons (1-4, 0-2) have lost six straight and are coming off a 31-24 loss to North Carolina State last weekend.

Its going to be an uphill battle, Wake Forest coach Dave Clawson told the Winston-Salem Journal.

input:
Stocks: Emerging from a month-long funk?
April has been a tough month for investors, with the Nasdaq taking a sharp dive and the other major markets languishing in negative territory.
But U.S. stock futures were pointing
continuation:
to a positive open on Wednesday, suggesting that Wall Street's worst fears may be over.
The S&P 500 index SPX, +0.09% is down 0.6% so far this week, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, -0.03% is off 0.4%. The Nasdaq Composite Index COMP, +0.13% is off 0.2%, while the Russell 2000 index of smaller-company stocks is up 0.1%.

Investors are still digesting the latest batch of earnings reports from companies such as Amazon AMZN, +0.16%, Apple AAPL, +0.15% and Facebook FB, +0.14%.
"Earnings season is coming to an end, and we're seeing some pretty good numbers," said Quincy Krosby, chief market strategist at Prudential Financial in Newark, New Jersey. "I think it's just a matter of time before people start to feel more optimistic about the economy."
A report released Tuesday by the National Association of Realtors showed existing home sales rose 1.5

input:
You say chorizo, I say....? Exactly how to pronounce the spicy pork sausage has got viewers of Masterchef in a pickle. But is there a right way and a wrong way?
"Iberico pork with grilled calam
continuation:
ari," says one contestant. "It's not that hard."
But what does it actually mean? And how can you tell if you're eating it correctly?
We've put together a handy guide to help you make the most of your chorizo-eating experience.
How to pronounce chorizo:
Chorizo is spelt differently depending on which part of Spain you come from.
The word comes from the Spanish word for 'pig' or 'chorizo', which means'spicy pork'.
In Spain, it's commonly used as a substitute for sausages.
However, in other parts of the world, like the UK, it's often used as a substitute for bacon.
There are three different ways to pronounce chorizo, but they all have their own advantages and disadvantages.
1. The Spanish way
The Spanish way is the most common way to pronounce chorizo.
In Spain, it's commonly used as a substitute for sausages. However, in other parts of the world, like the UK, it's often used as a substitute for bacon.
2. The Italian way
Italian pronunciation of chorizo differs slightly from its Spanish counterpart.

input: PHILADELPHIA  Today, electrophysiologists from Penn Medicine implanted the regions first subcutaneous implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) for sudden cardiac arrest, a potentially fatal electrical malfunction
continuation:
that occurs when the heart suddenly stops beating. The ICD was placed in the right ventricle of an adult male patient with Sudden Cardiac Arrest (SCA).

We are thrilled to be able to offer this life-saving technology to our patients and their families, said Dr. John J. Mihalik, chief of cardiology at Penn Presbyterian Medical Center. The ICD will help us save more lives and improve the quality of life for those who have been affected by Sudden Cardiac Arrest.

Sudden cardiac arrest is the leading cause of death in the United States, resulting in more than 400,000 deaths each year, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. In Pennsylvania alone, there were nearly 1,200 cases of SCA in 2015, according to the Pennsylvania Department of Health.

This device has the potential to significantly reduce the number of people who die as a result of Sudden Cardiac Arrest, said Dr. David A. Rabinowitz, director of the Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care and Sleep Medicine at Penn Presbyterian Medical Center and co-principal investigator of the study. Our goal

input:
UPDATE: Motorola is getting their pico projector from Microvision, a TI competitor.
DLP Products Shows New Developments in Pico-Projection Three manufacturers announce support for DLP powered projection in mobile devices DALLAS - October 3
continuation:
, 2012 - DLP Products, Inc., the world's leading manufacturer of digital light processing (DLP) products, today announced that it will be exhibiting at Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona, Spain, February 25-28, 2013. The company will also be demonstrating new developments in its Pico-projector product line at this year's MWC. "We are excited to showcase our new Pico-projector product line at MWC," said Dr. John Lai, president and CEO of DLP Products. "The market demand for portable projectors has increased dramatically over the past few years and we are confident that the DLP technology we have developed will enable us to meet the growing demand for high-quality, cost-effective projectors for mobile applications."
"We are very pleased to be working with DLP Products again on this new product line," said Dr. Michael J. Koehler, chairman and chief executive officer of Microvision. "Microvision is committed to developing innovative technologies that address the needs of our customers. We look forward to continuing to work with DLP Products as they continue to expand their product offering."
About DLP Products, Inc.
Headquartered in Dallas, Texas

input: HOUSTON - Feb. 17, 2018 - PRLog -- Demetria Smith is a mortgage broker and community activist. She recently made headlines when the Democratic Party wrongly bumped her from the primary ballot, over a banking mix-up that caused her filing
continuation:
fee to be more than $1,000.

I was shocked, Smith said. I thought they were going to let me run for office because I have been involved in politics my whole life. I didnt think it would be a big deal.

Smith was one of several candidates who filed for the Houston City Council District 4 seat this week. Her name was mistakenly put on the ballot by the Democratic Party.

Its very disheartening to see someone you worked so hard for be taken out of the race, she said.

The Harris County Democratic Party told KPRC 2 their mistake was due to a clerical error.

We are looking into what happened and we are working with Ms. Smith to resolve this matter as quickly as possible, the party said in a statement.

Smith says she has already started raising money for her campaign.

Im just going to keep fighting for the people, Smith said. Im not going to let them take my voice away. I will continue to fight until the last vote is cast.

WME has an

extensive track record of working with some of the worlds most iconic brands, including The Walt Disney Company (NYSE: DIS), Comcast Corporation (NASDAQ: CMCSA) and ViacomCBS Inc. (Nasdaq: VIAC).
We are excited to partner with WME, which is well-positioned to accelerate our growth strategy as we continue to expand our presence across the globe, said Jim Gianopulos, Chief Executive Officer of CBS All Access. We believe this partnership will enable us to further strengthen our position as a leading subscription streaming service, while also expanding our reach into international markets. We look forward to continuing to build on our strong momentum and delivering more value to our customers, partners and shareholders.
We are thrilled to be joining forces with one of the industrys premier creative talent agencies, said David Geffen, Chairman and Co-Founder of Silver Lake. We look forward to partnering with Jim and his talented team to help create even greater value for all of our stakeholders.

input: Esther Jung, a 12-year-old Illinois girl, died when a snow bank fell on her and a playmate, the Chicago Daily Herald is reporting. The young lady is one of five deaths attributed to this past weekends winter
continuation:
storm that dumped more than two feet of snow in some parts of the state.

The other four victims were an elderly woman who was struck by a car while crossing the street; a man who died after he was hit by a tractor-trailer while shoveling snow off his driveway; and two women who were swept away by floodwaters from a nearby creek.

Jungs death is being investigated as an accident, but police are still looking into how she ended up in the path of the snowbank, which had fallen onto the sidewalk. Her mother told the newspaper that the girl had been playing outside with another child when it happened.

I dont know what happened, said Esthers mother, Yvonne Jung, according to WLS-TV. I dont even know if I should be here talking to you right now, because Im just so shocked.

Police have not yet released any information about the circumstances surrounding the incident.

input:
The text of this post was updated and expanded on May 8. It appears in the June 5, 2014 issue of The New York Review.
As the first heavy fighting began in eastern Ukraine in early May, with an attempt by Ukrainian forces to retake
continuation:
the city of Mariupol from pro-Russian separatists, a Russian journalist named Vladimir Solovyov took to his Facebook page to announce that he would be covering the conflict as a correspondent for the Russian news agency RIA Novosti (Russias News Agency) from the front lines.
Solovyov had been living in Kiev since 2009, where he had worked as a reporter for the independent media outlet Meduza, which is known for its critical coverage of Russian President Vladimir Putin. In 2013, Meduzas editor-in-chief, Mikhail Khodorkovsky, fled to London after being arrested and charged with tax evasion and embezzlement in Russia. He has not been seen or heard from since.
On May 1, Solovyov posted a photo of himself on the front line, writing: Im going to Mariupol. Ill be there until the end. Ill write about it every day. If you want to know whats going on, follow me on Facebook.
He also posted a video of him interviewing a man who identified himself as a member of the self-proclaimed Donetsk People

input:
BEREA, Ohio -- Trent Richardson and Alfred Morris are good friends, a couple of rookie halfbacks hailing from the same hometown who reached the NFL via different routes.
Richardson came to the Browns from a major college in the first
continuation:
round (No. 3 overall) of the 2011 draft. Morris was drafted by the Redskins in the third round that year.
Morris said they've been texting each other throughout the offseason.
"It's great to have him around," Morris said. "I think we're both going to do really well."
Morris has had his share of ups and downs during his career, but he's never felt more comfortable than he does right now. He's on pace to rush for at least 1,000 yards, which would be the second-best single-season rushing total in franchise history.
"It feels good," Morris said. "I feel like I'm playing my best football. I feel like I'm doing everything I can to help this team win."
Morris is coming off one of his best games as a pro when he rushed 18 times for 93 yards and a touchdown against the Bengals on Sunday. He also caught two passes for 16 yards.
"He's a very versatile player," coach Mike Pettine said. "He can run the ball. He can catch the ball. He can block. He can do a lot of things. It's just a matter of him being consistent and getting better every

input:
UN official says footage of Sri Lankan troops executing rebel soldiers is genuine.
The footage was shot during the final stages of the Sri Lankan army's battle against the separatist Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE).
Alston said
continuation:
he had spoken to a number of people who were in the area at the time and confirmed that it was real.
He said the video, which has been widely shared on social media, was "disturbing" but did not amount to war crimes or crimes against humanity.
The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, Zeid Ra'ad al-Hussein, told reporters in Geneva on Wednesday that he had seen the footage and found it "very disturbing".
He said: "I can confirm that I have seen the video. It is very disturbing.
"It shows what appears to be Sri Lankan forces shooting at unarmed civilians, including women and children.
"We are looking into this matter and we will take appropriate action."
Sri Lanka's defence ministry rejected the report, saying there was no evidence to back up Alston's claims.
In a statement, spokesman Ruwan Wijewardene said: "There is absolutely no truth whatsoever in the allegation made by the UN high commissioner for human rights regarding the alleged execution of LTTE cadres by Sri Lankan military personnel."
He added: "We would like to state categorically that the Sri Lankan armed forces have never engaged in

input:
Max Levchin, the founder of recently-acquired Slide and co-founder of PayPal, has been named Google's newest vice president of engineering.
Levchin joined the company as part of Google's $182 million acquisition of Slide, the company
continuation:
he founded in 2007. He will report directly to Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google.
In a blog post, Levchin said that he is "excited" to join Google at this point in its history. "We're building a new kind of search engine for the world," he wrote. "I can't wait to see what we build together."
Levchin was previously a partner at Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, where he helped lead the firm's investments in companies such as Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn. He also served as an advisor to President Barack Obama during his 2008 presidential campaign.
Google's announcement comes just days after it was reported that Levchin would be stepping down from his role as chief technology officer at PayPal to focus on his new role at Google. In a statement released last week, Levchin said that he had decided to leave PayPal because he wanted to spend more time with his family.
Slide was acquired by Google earlier this year for an undisclosed sum. The deal came less than a month after Levchin announced that he would be leaving PayPal. At the time, he said that he would be taking some time off to spend more time with his family.
Levchin

input:
An illustration of the Apple Inc. logo taken on Jan. 30, 2015 in Lille, France.
Sometime in 2000, my colleague Verlyn started bringing his Mac laptop to our New York Times editorial board meetings. The rest of us would
continuation:
take turns using it for a few hours each week. It was a great way to learn more about the company and its products.
But over time, I began to notice that the MacBook Pro he brought with him wasnt as fast or powerful as other laptops we used at the Times. It was also heavier than the others.
I asked him if he had noticed any differences in performance between the MacBook Pro he brought with him and other laptops we used at the Times.
He told me that he hadnt noticed any difference, but he didnt have a lot of experience with MacBooks. He said that when he did use them, they seemed to be faster and more responsive than the other laptops we were using.
It turned out that the MacBook Pro he brought with him was one of the first models released after Steve Jobs took over as chief executive of Apple in 1997. At the time, Apple was still called Apple Computer by many people who worked at the company.
When Jobs came back from an extended leave of absence in October 1997, he announced that the company would be changing its name to Apple Inc.
The new name was meant to symbolize the company

input: An interview with Ted Koppel, a favorite former journalist on the liberal left was brought to light by NewsBusters Monday. Like most people reading the article, I was taken aback by Koppels honesty about the current state of
continuation:
affairs in the media.

Koppel said that he had never seen anything like this in his career as a reporter and anchor for CBS Evening News, NBC Nightly News, and ABC World News Tonight.

He went on to say:

I think what we are seeing now is the end of an era. Its a sad day when you cant get your facts straight. Its a sad day when you cant tell the difference between fact and fiction. And its a sad day when you dont even know if youre telling the truth or not.

In other words, there is no longer any sense of objectivity or fairness in the mainstream media.

Koppel also pointed out that many of the major news outlets are owned by the same conglomerates who control the Democratic Party. He added that they have been bought and paid for by George Soros and other wealthy liberals.

Koppel concluded his remarks by saying:

Its a sad day in American journalism. Weve lost the ability to be objective and fair. Weve lost the ability to

input:
Researchers have developed a new compound that may soon be developed into an effective treatment for melanoma, the deadliest form of skin cancer.
Melanoma may be halted by a newly developed drug.
Skin cancer is the most pervasive form of cancer in
continuation:
the United States and kills more people each year than any other malignancy, according to the American Cancer Society (ACS).
The ACS estimates that more than 400,000 Americans will be diagnosed with melanoma this year.
A team of researchers at The Scripps Research Institute (TSRI) in La Jolla, California, has developed a new compound that could be used as a potential treatment for melanoma.
The research was published in the journal Nature Communications.
Weve been working on this compound for about 10 years now, said study co-author Dr. Yigal Zilberman, a professor of dermatology at TSRI. Its a small molecule that binds to a protein called CXCR4, which is found on the surface of melanocytes, or cells that produce melanin, the pigment that gives skin its color.
CXCR4 plays a critical role in the immune systems ability to fight off harmful bacteria and viruses. It also helps regulate gene expression.
If we can block the interaction between the CXCR4 protein and the melanocyte, then it might be possible to stop the growth of

input:
Cobblers midfielder Sam Foley has given an interesting insight into the differences between playing for current manager Keith Curle and former boss Dean Austin.
Austin was handed the permanent job following a brief stint as caretaker manager at the end of last season,
continuation:
but he lasted just three games in charge before being sacked.
Foley is one of several players who have been linked with moves away from the club this summer.
The Cobblers are looking to strengthen their squad ahead of the 2019/20 campaign, which kicks off on Saturday when they host Southend United.
And speaking to the clubs official website, Foley spoke about his time under Austin, saying: I think it was a really good experience, I enjoyed my time there and I learned a lot from him.
We had a good relationship, we got on really well and he made me feel like I was part of the family. He gave me a chance to play every week and that helped me grow as a player and as a person.
Im sure hell be back next year and hopefully we can do better than what we did last year.
When asked how different things were under Curle compared to Austin, Foley added: I would say its a little bit different.
Its a little bit more tactical. Its a little bit more possession based. Were trying

input:
The Burroughs High School girls varsity basketball team continued its winning streak on Tuesday night after a 59-35 win over Hesperia High School.
The win came on Senior Night, and advanced the girls to 9-0 in the Mojave
continuation:
Desert Athletic League (MDAL) with two games left in the regular season.
This is our last game for seniors, so we wanted to make it special, said Burroughs head coach John Kowalski. We had a lot of kids who have been here since their freshman year. It was nice to see them go out on a high note.
Burroughs jumped out to an early lead and never looked back as they led by as many as 21 points in the first half.
I think we did a good job of taking care of the ball and not giving up too many easy baskets, said Kowalski. We played hard and competed. We didnt give up any second chance opportunities and thats what you need to do when you are playing at this level.
Junior guard Alyssa Pacheco led all scorers with 17 points. She also had five rebounds, three assists and two steals.
Senior guard/forward Gabriela Hernandez added 11 points and seven rebounds, while junior guard/forward Mariah Rodriguez scored 10 points and grabbed six rebounds.
They are very balanced

input:
With a little knowledge and understanding of car insurance, you can best optimize your insurance purchase and enjoy great benefits in the future.
While zeroing in on car insurance, low insurance premium often remains the sole deciding factor.
There is no denying the
continuation:
fact that there are many factors to consider when it comes to buying an insurance policy.
In this article, we will take a look at some of the most important factors that you need to keep in mind while shopping for an insurance policy.
Insurance coverage
One of the first things you need to check is whether or not the company offers comprehensive or collision coverage.
Comprehensive coverage ensures that your vehicle is fully insured against any damage caused by other vehicles or pedestrians.
Collision coverage, on the other hand, covers all damages that occur during an accident, such as broken windows, windshields, body panels, etc.
You should always make sure that the company you choose offers both types of coverage so that you dont have to worry about being stuck with only one type of coverage if you get into an accident.
Price
The second thing you need to consider is the price of the insurance policy you want to buy.
Its easy to get caught up in the idea of getting the cheapest insurance policy possible.
However, this could end up costing you more in the long run.
A good way to find out how much youre paying for insurance is to compare quotes from different companies

input:
Euro zone finance ministers and the International Monetary Fund began their third attempt in as many weeks to release emergency aid for Greece on Monday, with policymakers saying a write-down of Greek debt is off the table for now.
Greek Finance Minister Yannis St
continuation:
ournaras told reporters after talks with IMF Managing Director Christine Lagarde that "no decision has been taken" on whether to accept an offer from euro zone officials to write down Greek debt by up to 100 billion euros ($122 billion).
The IMF had earlier said it was ready to help Greece but only if Athens took concrete steps to cut its budget deficit and reform its bloated public sector.
Lagarde said the two sides were still far apart on how to achieve those goals.
"We are not there yet," she said. "I don't think we will be here tomorrow."
Greece's leftist Syriza party won a landslide election victory last month promising to end austerity measures imposed under its international bailouts. The new government wants to renegotiate the terms of the country's EU/IMF bailout, which runs out at the end of this year.
But euro zone officials have made clear they do not want to give Greece any more time than necessary to implement reforms.
They say Athens needs to take action to reduce its budget deficit to below 3 percent of gross domestic product (GDP) over the next three years or risk being kicked out of the single currency bloc.
A senior euro zone official said on Sunday

input: President Donald Trump tweeted on Tuesday about prisoners of war, and was immediately and deservedly deluged with replies and retweets regarding the late Sen. John McCain, a former POW with whom Trump frequently clashed and who he famously insulted over being captured
continuation:
during the Vietnam War.

Trumps tweets came after a New York Times report that the White House is considering a pardon for Paul Whelan, an American citizen detained in Iran since 2016.

John McCain would have been very happy to see this happen! Trump tweeted. He loved our country so much, but never let us know it!

McCain died last year at age 81 from brain cancer.

The presidents comments drew immediate pushback from Democrats, including Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) and Rep. Adam Schiff (D-Calif.), chairman of the House Intelligence Committee.

Schiff called Trumps tweet disgraceful, while Schumer said Trumps comments were outrageous.

Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) also criticized Trumps comments, calling them disgusting.

I dont think anyone should be pardoned for crimes they did not commit, Graham told reporters on Capitol Hill.

Trump has repeatedly attacked McCain for his military service,

input:
A railroad groups lawsuit against a state plan to remove 34 miles of train tracks has been delayed again, this time until the end of January.
Suzanne Messer, a lawyer for the Adirondack Railway Preservation Society, said
continuation:
in an email Thursday that she was pleased with the courts decision to delay the case until the end of the month.
The group sued New York State Department of Transportation Commissioner James Redeker last year after he announced plans to cut the tracks between Saranac Lake and Plattsburgh by more than two-thirds.
Redeker said the cuts were needed to make way for new rail lines, but opponents say they will hurt tourism and hamper economic development.
Messer says her client is still looking for ways to block the project.

BOSTON -- CC Sabathia snapped out of his Red Sox funk, striking out 10 in six innings to beat Boston for the first time in five tries this season and lead the New York Yankees to a 5-2 victory Tuesday.
The win
continuation:
was the Yankees' second straight after dropping their previous three games at Fenway Park.
Sabathia (5-4) gave up two runs on four hits with one walk and seven strikeouts. He had lost his previous three starts against the Red Sox.
"It's nice to get a win," Sabathia said. "I've been struggling a little bit, but I feel like I'm getting back to my old self. It's good to have that confidence."
Boston starter Rick Porcello (6-7) gave up four runs on eight hits in 6 2/3 innings. The left-hander struck out five and walked none.
"He was pretty good," Red Sox manager John Farrell said. "He didn't give us a lot of run support, but he kept us off balance and made some pitches when we needed them. We just weren't able to capitalize on those opportunities."
Yankees reliever Dellin Betances pitched a perfect ninth for his 17th save in 18 chances.
Porcello retired the first nine batters he faced before Aaron Judge led off the third inning with a homer to right field. It was Judge's 11th homer of the season, matching the major league record

input: In a shameful first, in 2016 TN Assembly elections, polling in two constituencies was put off due to the pernicious effect of money power, to quote the EC. In a telling indictment of the States political class
continuation:
, the ruling AIADMK and its ally DMK have been accused of indulging in vote-buying in both cases. The Election Commission (EC) has ordered an inquiry into the matter.

This is not the first time that Tamil Nadu has witnessed electoral malpractices. A few years ago, then Chief Minister O Panneerselvam had ordered a probe into allegations of vote-buying in Thoothukudi and Kanniyakumari Lok Sabha constituencies, which went to polls on April 18, 2014. The poll panel had found no evidence of any wrongdoing by either party.

However, this is the first time that the EC has taken cognizance of the issue. The poll panel has directed the state government to submit a report on the issue within 15 days.

The EC has also asked the state government to take action against all those who were involved in the malpractice.

We are looking into it, a senior EC official told IANS.

According to sources, the EC has received complaints from various quarters about the alleged malpractices.

It is a matter of serious concern. We will look into it, said

input: Ping An Insurance (Group) Co.'s (2318.HK) first-time disclosure that it holds a 5.01% stake in global banking giant HSBC Holdings Plc. (0005.HK) highlights the Chinese
continuation:
insurers growing appetite for overseas assets.

HSBC shares have surged more than 30% this year, making it the best performing stock on the FTSE 100 index.FTNMX1770, as investors bet the British bank will benefit from Chinas economic recovery and rising interest rates.

But HSBC is not the only foreign company Ping An plans to invest in. It also has a 4.99% stake in Standard Chartered PLC (STAN.L), according to data compiled by Bloomberg.

The Hong Kong-based insurer, which was spun off from Ping An Financial Group in 2007, has been buying stakes in companies around the world as part of its strategy to diversify away from its core insurance business.

We are looking at a wide range of investment opportunities, said Guo Shuqing, chairman and chief executive officer of Ping An Life Insurance Co., in an interview with Bloomberg Television last month. If we find something interesting, we would definitely consider investing in it.

Guo declined to comment when asked whether Ping An had made any investment decisions in the past few months.

HSBC shares were up 0.6

input:
Despite the loss, fans at home in Burlington say they are incredibly proud of the team's successes this season.
In the first round of the NCAA basketball tournament, the University of Vermont suffered a tough loss.
The University of Vermont fell to Florida
continuation:
Gulf Coast in the first round of the NCAA Tournament on Friday night.
The Catamounts were down by as many as 17 points in the second half, but still came up just short against the Eagles.
"I think that we're really proud of our program and what we've been able to accomplish this year," said UVM Head Basketball Coach John Becker. "We've got a lot of young guys that haven't played a lot of varsity minutes yet, so I think it's great for them to get out there and compete with some of the best players in the country."
Vermont has now lost in the first round of the NCAA Tournament three times in the last four years. The last time was in 2016 when the Catamounts lost to Texas A&M-Corpus Christi in the first round.
Becker says he is confident his team will bounce back next season.
"We've got a lot of good pieces coming back, and we'll be better next year," said Becker. "We'll be better next year than we were this year."
With the loss, the Catamounts finished the season with a record of 19-12.

input: We all take inspiration from someone or something: with credit being paid to beloved former teachers or batty great aunts for giving them the strength to succeed, but there cant be that many blokes who have been empowered by Elton John
continuation:
.

The singer-songwriter is one of the biggest names in the music industry, and hes had his fair share of hits over the years  including Rocket Man and Candle In The Wind.

But what does it mean to inspire people? And how do you go about doing so?

To find out, we spoke to some of the worlds most influential men and women.

Elton John

John has sold more than 100 million records worldwide. Hes won two Grammys, an Academy Award and a Golden Globe, and hes been knighted by Queen Elizabeth II.

He was also the first solo male artist to top the Billboard Hot 100 chart five times in a row, and hes currently working on his sixth studio album, Rocketman.

I think Ive always been inspired by other artists, John told us. I dont know if its just because I grew up listening to Elvis Presley and Johnny Cash and Bob Dylan and Jimi Hendrix and all those guys.

input: NEW YORK  One recent spring morning in the Utah desert, Jerry Foote received an ecstatic e-mail that gravitational forces were causing two stars to orbit each other, with one star swallowing matter from its companion. Rudolf Novak received the same message
continuation:
a few days later.

It was very exciting for both of us, said Mr. Foote, a theoretical astrophysicist at New York University who is working on a new theory of how galaxies form and evolve. We felt like we had just discovered a new kind of galaxy.

But they didnt actually know what they were seeing. It wasnt until months later that Mr. Foote realized he had stumbled upon something far more complex than he could have imagined.

In a paper published this month in the journal Nature, Mr. Foote and his colleagues describe their discovery as a first step toward understanding why some galaxies are so big and others so small.

Galaxies are the largest objects in the universe. The Milky Way is about 200,000 light-years across, and the Large Magellanic Cloud (LMC) is about 100,000 light-years away. In comparison, the sun is about 4.5 times the size of the full moon.

The LMC is one of the most massive clouds of gas and dust in the universe, and it is thought to be the birthplace of our own solar system. Astronomers believe

input:
TRUCKEE, Calif.  Property owners this week overwhelmingly approved a special tax to fund maintenance for the Brickelltown streetscape project.
At Tuesdays Truckee Town Council meeting, returned mailed ballots (30 out of 34
continuation:
) showed that voters supported Measure A by a margin of 2-to-1.
The measure will raise an estimated $2.4 million per year in property taxes over the next 10 years. The funds would be used to maintain and improve the street system, which was completed in 2014.
The town has already spent about $3.5 million on the project, which includes new sidewalks, curbs, gutters, lighting, landscaping and other improvements. It also includes a new pedestrian bridge over the Truckee River.
In 2016, the council voted unanimously to approve a five-year capital improvement plan for the streetscape project.
"We are thrilled with the results of tonight's vote," said Truckee Mayor Andy Beerman. "I want to thank our community partners who worked so hard to make it happen. This is a great example of what can happen when we work together to achieve common goals."
Voters were asked if they wanted to increase their annual property tax rate by 0.75 percent. If passed, the rate would go up from 1.25 mills to 1.5 mills.
According to the ballot language, No tax increase shall be levied or assessed upon any parcel of real

Photographers from Syracuse.com took advantage

of that opportunity on Wednesday and captured some great images.
The photos were taken as part of SCRIBAs Take a Look Inside event, which was held in conjunction with the annual Nuclear Energy Institute (NEI) conference in New York City.

input:
The gritty streets of this 4-by-12-block sliver of a town in densely populated and urbanized northern Hudson County might be the last place to expect to find a largely volunteer fire department.
Such departments are usually associated with small-
continuation:
town America, where residents band together to protect one another from the dangers of the outside world.
But thats not the case here.
This is the first time Ive ever seen something like this happen, said Fire Chief Michael DeAngelis. We dont have a lot of people willing to help us out, but when we need it most, they step up.
DeAngelis and his crew were responding to a call at about 1:30 p.m. on Sunday when they spotted flames coming from the roof of an abandoned building. The blaze quickly spread to other nearby buildings.
Firefighters battled the blaze for more than two hours before it was finally brought under control. No injuries were reported and the cause of the fire remains under investigation.
DeAngelis, who has been with the department for 12 years, described the incident as very unusual.
Ive never seen anything like it, he said. Its pretty rare to see something like this happen in New Jersey. Were just glad no one got hurt. It could have been a lot worse.

input:
MALAYSIA IS willing to help Thailand end the ethno-religious conflict in the deep South using peaceful means, Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said yesterday, suggesting the root cause of the problem was not religion but injustice.
G
continuation:
roups from both sides have been fighting for more than a decade over land and resources in the remote provinces of Pattani, Yala and Narathiwat.
The violence has killed at least 3,000 people and displaced hundreds of thousands since it began in 2004.
We are ready to talk with them (Thai authorities) if they want to talk to us, Mr Mahathir told reporters in Kuala Lumpur after meeting Thai Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha.
We dont want to kill each other, we dont want to kill our own people, we dont want to kill anybody. We just want to live peacefully together.
Malaysia is the worlds fourth largest exporter of palm oil and Thailand is its second biggest buyer.
Both countries are members of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (Asean).
Mr Mahathir said he had raised the issue of human rights abuses during his talks with Mr Prayut.
I asked him what happened to all the human rights abuses that were happening in the past 10 years or so, he said.
He assured me

input:
Taoiseach Leo Varadkar has said he would be open to environmental measures including giving people money back for returning used plastic bottles, writes Elaine Loughlin, Political Reporter.
Green party leader Eamon Ryan has called on the Government to
continuation:
introduce a deposit return scheme (DRS) for single-use plastics such as plastic straws, cutlery and cotton buds.
Mr Varadkar told RT radio's Today with Claire Byrne show: "I wouldn't rule out anything at this stage, but I think it is important that we don't go too far in one direction or the other.
"We need to make sure that we are not overburdening the environment by introducing something like a DRS."
He added: "The idea of putting money back into people's pockets is a good idea.
"It is an easy way to get people to reduce their use of single-use items."
Mr Varadkar said he had spoken to Taoiseach Michel Martin about the issue last week.
Asked whether there were any plans to introduce a DRS in the next budget, Mr Varadkar said: "We will have to wait and see what happens in the coming weeks and months."
Mr Varadkar said he did not want to pre-empt the outcome of the European Parliament elections, which take place on May 26th.
However, he said he was "pretty confident" the Greens would win seats in the

input:
The SA under-20 national team are proving to be peerless in the ongoing Cosafa U20 Championships in Zambia.
If their bullish performance in group stages, where they humiliated Mauritius (5-0) and Eswatini (
continuation:
4-1), is anything to go by, then South Africa have a chance of making history at this years tournament.
In the opening match on Friday night, they thrashed Lesotho (3-0) with goals from Khama Billiat, Themba Zwane and Thulani Hlatshwayo.
They followed that up with a 4-1 win over Swaziland (1-0) and a 1-0 victory over Botswana (1-0).
Billiat opened the scoring for the hosts against Lesotho after just three minutes when he headed home from close range following a corner kick.
It was not long before Billiat doubled his tally as he finished off a flowing move with a low shot into the far corner of the net.
Zwane made it 3-0 shortly after the half-hour mark when he converted a penalty after being fouled inside the box.
Swaziland pulled one back in the 57th minute through Siboniso Mabena, who scored from the spot after being tripped in the area.
But South Africa held firm to seal all three points and book their place in the semi-finals.

input:
UNIONDALE, N.Y. - The talk before the season was that the Los Angeles Kings were ready to contend for a playoff berth. Five games into the season, they're turning words into deeds.
The Kings made it four wins
continuation:
in a row with a 4-2 victory over the New York Rangers on Thursday night at Nassau Coliseum.
"We've got a lot of work to do," said defenseman Drew Doughty, who had two goals and an assist. "It's still early, but we're playing really well right now."
Related Coverage Preview: Rangers at Kings
Los Angeles (3-1-0) has outscored its opponents by a combined score of 17-5 through its first five games. It's the best start in franchise history and the second-best start since the Kings went 5-0-0 from Nov. 21-Dec. 3, 2006.
"We're not where we want to be yet, but I'm very pleased with how we're playing," Kings coach Darryl Sutter said. "I think our guys are working hard and getting better every day. We're going to have some growing pains, but I like what I'm seeing."
Kings goaltender Jonathan Quick stopped 30 shots in his fifth straight win. He is 9-1-1 in his last 11 starts dating back to last season.
"He's been unbelievable," Doughty said. "He's been great all year long.

Jordan Rogers and JoJo Fletcher thought they were stepping for a quiet dinner on Saturday night, but the 27-year-old former football players family had other plans.
Jordan's family threw him and JoJo a surprise engagement party in

Thank you for being the best father to our children. Thank you for being the kindest, most generous person I've ever known. Thank you for being the most incredible husband. input:
Once upon a time, Ronald Reagan inaugurated America's Strategic Defense Initiative, a missile defense program that critics immediately derided as "Star Wars" -- pure fantasy.
Ronald Reagan's "Star Wars."
continuation:
(AP Photo/Evan Vucci, File)
In the early 1990s, President George H.W. Bush launched his own space-based missile defense system, known as Space-Based Infrared System, or SBIRS. It was supposed to be able to detect and destroy incoming missiles in low Earth orbit before they reached their targets.
The idea behind both programs was to make it harder for hostile nations to launch nuclear weapons against the United States and its allies by intercepting and destroying the warheads before they could reach their targets.
Both systems were designed to work with existing U.S. anti-ballistic missile defenses, such as those built at Fort Greely, Alaska; Vandenberg Air Force Base, California; and Cape Canaveral Air Force Station, Florida.
But neither system has been operational since the mid-1990s because of technical problems, cost overruns and other issues.
So what happened? Why didn't either program succeed? And how can we avoid repeating the mistakes of the past?
Here are answers to three questions:
How did we get into this mess in the first place?
It all started with the Cold War. In the late 1960s, the Soviet Union began developing a new

input:
Tennessee's state-run Achievement School District, which takes over low-performing schools and either runs them directly or hands them over to charter organizations, has run into partisan political trouble.
Several Democratic state lawmakers say they will propose bills this upcoming legislative
continuation:
session that would make it more difficult for the school district to privatize struggling schools.
The Tennessee Board of Education voted unanimously last week to approve a $2.1 billion budget for fiscal year 2018-19, which begins July 1. The board also approved an increase in property taxes by 2.5 percent.
Achievement School District officials have said the tax increase is needed to help pay for increased costs associated with the privatization of failing schools.
State Sen. Raumesh Akbari, D-Nashville, says he plans to introduce a bill that would require the state Department of Education to hold public hearings on any privatization proposal.
"We need to hear from parents, teachers and students," Akbari said in a statement. "I am committed to working with my colleagues to ensure that all voices are heard."
House Minority Leader Craig Fitzhugh, R-Shelbyville, told reporters after the vote that he believes there should be a public hearing before any decision is made on whether to privatize schools.
"I think there needs to be an open discussion about what we're going to do," Fitzhugh said. "We don't want to just throw money at a problem."

input: Magic Johnson has no regrets about the public nature of his conversations with New Orleans Pelicans general manager Dell Demps during the past two weeks as the Lakers tried to trade for Anthony Davis. Johnson believes his players are professional enough to handle hearing their names in trade
continuation:
rumors, and he doesnt think its a big deal.

Im not going to sit here and tell you that I didnt try to do everything I could to make sure we got the best player in the world. But at the end of the day, this is basketball. Its a business. Were trying to win championships. Were trying to get better every single day. And sometimes things dont work out the way you want them to work out.

But Ive never been one to say, Oh, I should have done this or I should have done that. Thats not my style. Im a winner. Im a winner. Im a winner. Im a winner. Im a winner. Im a winner. Im a winner. Im a winner

input: Senate President Chuck Morse has a plan to absorb a nearly $30 million budget shortfall created by a lawsuit over hospital payments. But it could come at the expense of a host of other legislative priorities, potentially putting spending bills in jeopardy, he said Monday.
continuation:
I dont know if were going to be able to do everything we want to do this year, Morse said. There are some things that need to get done, and I think theres a lot of pressure on us right now.

The state Supreme Court ruled last week that hospitals must pay more for medical care than they receive from the Medicaid program, which covers low-income and disabled people. The ruling is expected to cost the state about $28 million per year, according to an estimate by the Department of Health and Human Services.

Hospitals have appealed the court decision, but Morse said the Legislature will have to find another source of revenue to cover those costs.

Morse, D-Worcester, has proposed a bill that would allow the state to borrow money against future Medicaid reimbursements. He also wants to increase the states cigarette tax by $1 a pack to help fund health care programs.

Weve got to find a way to deal with this, Morse said. Its not just one thing. Its a whole series of

input: JILL FRIEDMAN HELFMAN is a partner in the Cleveland office of Taft Stettinius & Hollister LLP. She concentrates her practice in the area of family law. Ms. Helfman's experience includes both analysis and litigation
continuation:
, with an emphasis on child custody and parenting time matters.

Ms. Helfman has represented clients before the Ohio Supreme Court, the United States District Courts for the Northern and Southern Districts of Ohio, as well as various state courts throughout Ohio.

She also serves as a member of the Ohio State Bar Association's Family Law Section, where she has served as chairwoman of the section since its inception in 1997.

Ms. Helfman received her J.D. from the University of Cincinnati College-Conservatory of Music, and her B.A. from the University of Cincinnati. She is a member of the American Academy of Matrimonial Lawyers and the American Academy of Matrimonial Lawyers (Ohio).

The Miami Heat star is on his maiden visit to the country to promote the game. The 3-on-3 event will be held in Hyderabad, Bangalore and Delhi before culminating with the finals in Mumbai on September 29.
Two-time National
continuation:
Basketball Association (NBA) Most Valuable Player (MVP) Dwyane Wade said it was a dream come true for him to play in India. "It's a dream come true for me to play in India. I've been to India many times but this is the first time I'm going to play in front of my home crowd. It's an amazing feeling," he said.
Wade, who played for the Chicago Bulls from 2008 to 2016, has won three NBA championships and two Olympic gold medals with the U.S. national team.
"This is a great opportunity for me to get back out there and show what I can do and how much I love playing basketball. This is a great way to end the season and start the next one."
He added: "I'm looking forward to getting out there and having some fun. We're going to have a lot of fans here so we're going to have a lot of people cheering for us and that's going to be a good thing."
Former NBA All-Star Shaquille O'Neal will also be present at the event.

What's behind the jolt that performers get from being onstage? The necessity, the difficulty, the possibility of connecting with the audience.
Sam Pressler knows that the connection is everything, and is a master at helping people, specifically those with military
continuation:
backgrounds, understand what it means to be on stage in front of an audience.
Pressler is the founder and executive director of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs' (VA) Center for Performing Arts Education (CPAE). He also serves as president of the American Theatre Wing (ATW), which represents more than 4,000 professional theatres across the United States and Canada.
In his new book, "The Art of Connecting: The Power of Being on Stage," he explains how performing arts can help veterans find their way back to civilian life.
Here are excerpts from our conversation.
Q: What do you mean when you say "connecting?"
A: It's not so much about the act of performing, but rather the experience of performing. You have to be able to connect with your audience. If you don't, they're not going to like you. And if you don't like them, they're not going to like you.
Q: How do you go about connecting with audiences?

input:
Swirling dust devils on Mars have given NASA scientists both a scientific treat and a very welcome power boost.
On 10 March, the rover Spirit captured images of two dust devils in one day. It is the first time any have been seen on Mars
continuation:
.
"It's really exciting to be able to see these things," said Michael Meyer, an astrobiologist at Nasa's Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) in Pasadena, California, who was part of the team that made the discovery. "We've never seen anything like this before."
The dust devils, which are caused by winds blowing across the surface of the red planet, were spotted by Spirit as it drove along a ridge in Gale Crater, where the rover has been exploring for more than three years.
Spirit had already found evidence of wind-blown sand dunes in the crater's south-eastern region, but the new images show the dunes are moving northwards.
Meyer told the Associated Press news agency: "I don't know if we're going to get a chance to go back out there [to investigate], but I'm pretty sure we'll get another look at them."
Dust devils are common on Earth, but they can be difficult to study because they move so quickly. The most famous dust devil ever recorded, however, took place in 2003 when a giant dust storm swept across North America.
Spirit's images also revealed that the dust devils are moving away from the rover

input: Standard & Poor's said on Wednesday it was more likely than before to cut General Electric Co's credit rating in the next two years after activist investor Nelson Peltz's purchase of a $
continuation:
1 billion stake in the company.

The Wall Street Journal reported late on Tuesday that Peltz, whose Trian Fund Management LP owns about 8 percent of GE, had bought an additional 1.2 million shares of GE stock, bringing his total stake to 9.6 percent.

GE shares were down 0.8 percent at $12.95 in afternoon trading on the New York Stock Exchange.

Peltz is known for buying stakes in companies he believes have underperformed and pressuring management to make changes.

"We are more likely to lower our ratings over the next 12 months," S&P Global Ratings said in a note to clients. "This could occur if we do not see meaningful improvements in the company's operating performance."

S&P Global Ratings has a BBB+ rating with a stable outlook.

In its report, S&P Global Ratings said it expected GE to generate free cash flow (FCF) of $3.5 billion this year, up from $2.9 billion last year. It forecast FCF of $4.5 billion in 2013, up from $3.7 billion last year.

input:
Over half of Europeans think that Israel now presents the biggest threat to world peace according to a controversial poll requested by the European Commission.
According to the same survey, Europeans believe the United States contributes the most to world instability along with Afghanistan, Iran,
continuation:
North Korea and Russia.
The poll was carried out by YouGov on behalf of the EU's foreign policy chief Federica Mogherini, who is due to meet Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in Brussels next week.
Mogherini has been pushing for closer ties between the two countries since she took office in 2014.
In her first speech as foreign policy chief last year, she urged Israelis and Palestinians to "come together" to resolve their decades-long conflict.
She also called on both sides to work towards a two-state solution to end the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.
However, despite her efforts, relations between the two countries have soured over the past few years.
Last month, Israel announced plans to annex parts of the occupied West Bank if it is re-elected in March.
Palestinians say they will not accept any deal that would see the Jewish state expand its borders.
Israel captured the West Bank from Jordan in the 1967 Six-Day War and later annexed it in a move never recognised by the international community.
Since then, the Palestinian Authority (PA) has refused to recognise Israel's right to exist, saying it is an illegal occupation.

input: If President Clinton wants to see how activist government can solve social problems with strong public support, he should take a few days to visit Canada. With Toronto's World Series victory, the nationwide referendum on constitutional reform (including the status of Quebec), and the
continuation:
election of a new prime minister in Ottawa, it is clear that Canadians are ready for a change.

Canada is one of the world's most progressive countries when it comes to gay rights. It was the first G7 country to legalize same-sex marriage, and it has recently legalized civil unions for same-sex couples. It also has some of the strongest protections against discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity.

But there are still many areas where Canadian society lags behind the U.S. and other developed nations. For example, Canada does not have universal health care or paid family leave. And while the federal government spends more than twice as much per capita on social programs than the U.S., it doesn't do nearly enough to ensure that all Canadians have access to them.

In fact, according to a recent study by the Public Policy Institute of California, Canada ranks dead last among advanced economies in the percentage of its GDP devoted to social programs. The United States spends about 10 percent of its GDP on social programs, while Japan, Germany, and France spend between 20 and 30 percent of their gross domestic product on social programs.

It's no wonder that Canadians feel so strongly about the need to improve social
