I have tried my best to help the people of Aleppo. I gave them everything they needed: food, water, medical supplies, fuel, electricity. And then the Syrian regime came in and destroyed everything, Erdoan said.

If we dont do something, there will be nothing left for our children and grandchildren. We cannot live like this any longer, Erdoan said.

input: Andrew P. Fitzgerald, 50, formerly of Plattsburgh, N.Y., passed away Tuesday, March 5, 2019, at Sarasota Memorial Hospital with his family by his side. He was born in Plattsburgh, N.Y.,
continuation:
the son of the late John and Mary (Baker) Fitzgerald.
He is survived by his loving wife of 25 years, Susan; three sons, Andrew, Michael and Matthew; a step-son, Christopher; a step-daughter, Kristin; two sisters, Linda and Kathy; and many nieces and nephews.
He was predeceased by his parents.
A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated Saturday, March 9, at 10 a.m. at St. Joseph Church, Plattsburgh. The Rev. Thomas O'Brien will officiate. Burial will follow in St. Joseph Cemetery. Visitation will be held Friday from 6 to 8 p.m. at the DellaVecchia Funeral Home, Plattsburgh.
Memorial contributions may be made to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, 501 St. Jude Place, Memphis, TN 38105-9959.
To leave an online condolence, please visit www.dellavecchiafh.com.
Arrangements are under the direction of the DellaVecchia Funeral Home & Crematory, Plattsburgh.

input: My son Kris, an Army Ranger, was one of the first killed in action on October 19, 2001, in Operation Rhino, our first incursion into Afghanistan right after 9/11. Kris had been in Ranger School during that attack on American soil
continuation:
, and his death was a shock to us all.

Kriss story is not unique. There are many other young men and women who have paid the ultimate price for their countrys commitment to freedom and democracy around the world.

I want to share with you a few things I learned from my sons service:

1. You never know what will happen when you put your life on the line, but you can be prepared for anything.

2. Its important to take care of your family while youre serving in the military.

3. The sacrifices made by our military families are immeasurable.

4. We owe it to our veterans to give them the support they need so they can continue to serve our nation.

5. Our veterans deserve the respect they have earned over the years.

6. And finally, we should never forget those who gave their lives for our freedoms.

In honor of Veterans Day, I encourage you to read some of the stories of the brave men and women who served in the U.S. Armed Forces, and thank them for their service.

input: Alastair Cook has been granted more time to decide his future as Test captain, with England having privately advised that Fridays meeting with the director of cricket, Andrew Strauss, will not be followed by a definitive announcement on the subject.
continuation:
Cook, who is contracted until the end of the 2015 Ashes series, has been under pressure from some quarters to relinquish the captaincy in favour of Joe Root or Eoin Morgan, but the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) are understood to have made it clear that they want him to make a final decision this week.

Strauss is due to meet the players at their training base at Edgbaston on Thursday morning before holding further talks with Cook later in the day. The ECB will then hold a press conference at 11am on Friday to announce whether Cook will continue as skipper.

SALT LAKE CITY  Business leaders from around the state gathered at the Utah State Capitol on Thursday to sign the Utah Compact, an agreement they hope will help them attract and retain top talent.

The compact, which was originally signed by Gov. Gary Herbert in 2010, has been amended several times since then, including last year when the Legislature passed a bill that would have made it easier for businesses to leave Utah if they didnt want to abide by certain labor laws.

Were here today to reaffirm our commitment to each other as we move forward, said Salt Lake City Mayor Jackie Biskupski. I think its important to note that this is not just about business. Its about all of those things.

"Now it's on to phase two."
Jack says that to Liz while they're watching the GE sign on 30 Rockefeller Center switching off, and Kabletown's sign turning on in its place, and the line sets the tone for the entire
continuation:
episode.
Liz and Jack are sitting at a table with a bunch of people who have come to see the show.
They're talking about their lives and what they've been up to lately.
Kabletown is one of those places where everyone knows each other's business.
Everyone has some sort of connection to the place, whether it's a friend or a family member who works there, or maybe even someone who used to work there.
It's a tight - knit little community.
Jack tells Liz he's going to get a haircut, and when he comes back, she asks him if he wants to go out with her.
He says no, but he does want to take her to dinner.
When he gets home, he looks through his phone and finds a text from Liz: "I'm sorry I didn't call you last night.
I was so busy.
I had a lot on my mind.
I'm glad we got to spend time together this weekend.
You were really good to me.
I love you."
Jack doesn't respond right away, because he's not sure what to say.

to help you find the perfect pair for your listening pleasure.

input: That it's such a hidden statistic, however, is an embarrassing reflection of our collective ignorance. Hundreds more people died by suicide in Oregon in 2017 than by traffic crashes, firearms or drug overdose. The suicide rate in Oregon is well above the national average
continuation:
and has been steadily increasing for decades.

The state Department of Human Services reports that nearly 1,000 Oregonians die by suicide each year. That's about three times the number who die from motor vehicle accidents, two times the number who die from firearms, and four times the number who die from drug overdoses.

And yet we don't hear much about these deaths. It's as if they never happened.

We're not alone. According to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, suicide is the 10th leading cause of death in the United States and the second leading cause of death among young adults between the ages of 20 and 34.

In 2016, there were an estimated 47,000 suicides in the U.S., according to the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline. In Oregon, the number was even higher: 49,000.

Oregon's high suicide rate isn't just a problem for families and friends; it's a public health issue. A recent study published in the Journal of the American Medical Association found that suicide rates have risen across the country over the past 25 years.

Suicide is one of the most preventable causes of death in the U.S., but

input:
Every year in sports, theres a breakout player or a breakout moment that inspires the masses to dig deeper for their dreams.
Justin Holiday may be the next breakout story.
Now a mainstay in the NBA, Holiday is seeing a
continuation:
meteoric rise to stardom after being drafted by the Philadelphia 76ers in the first round of the 2014 NBA Draft.
The 21-year-old point guard has already been named an All-Star and is averaging career highs in points per game (17.6) and assists per game (5.8).
Holiday was also named to the Eastern Conference All-Rookie Team last season.
Hes had his fair share of ups and downs this season, but hes finally starting to show signs of life.
Here are three things we learned from Holidays performance against the Toronto Raptors on Tuesday:
1. Hes still got it
Its easy to forget just how good Holiday can be when hes not playing at a high level.
Last season, Holiday averaged 16.7 points, 4.3 rebounds and 3.0 assists per game.
But this season, Holiday has seen a drastic improvement.
In his last five games, hes averaging 17.2 points, 5.9 rebounds and 4.4 assists per game while shooting 50 percent from the field and 38 percent from three-point range.
Holiday

input: The 2019 Honda Pilot, on the outside, looks like any other modern SUV. It has the ride height and space thats convinced Americans to abandon cars and flock toward larger vehicles, and, like the rest of that segment, it blends in
continuation:
with its surroundings.

Inside, however, the Pilot is a different story. Its one of the best-looking crossovers on the market, if not the best-looking. Its interior design, which was first unveiled at the 2017 North American International Auto Show (NAIAS) in Detroit, has been refined over the last few years, and now its finally ready for prime time.

Hondas designers have done a great job of making the Pilot look more premium than it actually is. The front grille and headlamps are distinctive, as are the LED daytime running lights and the chrome trim around the windows and door handles. The Pilots tail lamps are also unique, and they give the crossover an aggressive appearance.

On the inside, the Pilots cabin feels like a luxury car. The seats are comfortable and supportive, and the center console has plenty of storage space. The Pilots large touchscreen infotainment system is easy to use, and it features Apple CarPlay and Android Auto compatibility.

But the real star of the show here is the Pilots exterior design. Its one of the most handsome c

input:
Which college degrees are the most and least valuable to Floridians?
The ubiquitous career advice hurled at young people sounds so simple. Make a career of your passions.
For some, its pitch perfect. They know what they love
continuation:
to do. They just need to find a way to make it happen. For others, its easier said than done.
A new report from WalletHub finds that Florida has one of the highest concentrations of bachelors degrees in the U.S. It also ranks among the top 10 states with the lowest average salary for those who have earned a bachelors degree.
WalletHub used data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics to rank all 50 states based on the value of their bachelors degree programs. The rankings were based on factors such as graduation rates, job placement rates, cost of tuition and student debt.
Heres a look at how Florida stacks up against the rest of the country when it comes to which college degrees are most and least valuable to residents:

input: The Vietnamese version of the 2010 census questionnaire used the words dieu tra to describe the population tally  but what the words really conveyed was something like a communist government investigation. On Korean forms, county was translated
continuation:
as municipality or district, and township was translated as subdistrict.

But in Vietnams case, the word dieu tra is not used at all. Instead, it is replaced by an abbreviated form of the same name: Di Tnh Trng. The abbreviation stands for Di Tnh Trng (Vietnam).

It is not clear why the Vietnamese government decided to use this abbreviation rather than the full name of the country, which would be Di Tnh Quc H Ch Minh (Vietnams northernmost province), or Di Tnh Bc Giang (Vietnams southernmost province) or Di Tnh Ph Thy (Vietnams easternmost province).

input:
The city took quotes on striping and marking of streets.
MUNCIE, Ind.  Local streets are due to get newly-painted center lines and other pavement markings soon.
The Muncie Board of Works and Public Safety on
continuation:
Tuesday approved a contract for the work, which is expected to cost about $30,000.
City officials said the work will be done in two phases. The first phase will begin this week and last about three weeks.
The second phase will start next week and last about four weeks.
Officials said it's part of a larger effort to improve pedestrian safety.

input: Despite Israels siege of Gaza, and the escalating displacement in the Negev and East Jerusalem, Palestinians have some reason to celebrate. In Washington a food co-op has passed a resolution calling for a boycott of Israeli products, confirming that
continuation:
Palestinian solidarity is alive and well.

The Food Co-op of Greater Washington (FCGW) voted unanimously last week to pass a resolution calling on its members to refrain from purchasing, using, or consuming any product or service produced or marketed by an Israeli entity that violates international law, including the Fourth Geneva Convention.

The vote came after months of deliberation, during which FCGWs board of directors debated whether to take a stand on the Israeli occupation of the West Bank and Gaza Strip. The board ultimately decided to go ahead with the resolution.

We felt it was our moral obligation to make a statement about the human rights violations taking place in the Occupied Palestinian Territories, said FCSW board member and former Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry.

Kerry, who served as US secretary of state under President Barack Obama, has long been one of the most outspoken critics of the Israeli governments policies toward the Palestinians. He told Haaretz earlier this year that he would not rule out running for president in 2016.

Im not going to tell you Ill never run for office again, Kerry said.

input:
Amnesty International calls upon Hamas (the Islamic Resistance Movement) to commit unequivocally to abide by international law, respect the rights of all Palestinians across the political spectrum and repudiate its policy of targeting Israeli civilians.
"As it prepares to form the next
continuation:
government in Gaza, Hamas must ensure that it does not allow itself to be used as a proxy for Israel," said Lynn Maalouf, Amnesty International's Middle East and North Africa Research Director. "The Palestinian people are entitled to live in peace and security with their neighbours, but this can only happen if there is an end to the conflict between Israel and Hamas."
Hamas has been accused of carrying out indiscriminate rocket attacks on civilian targets in Israel, including schools, hospitals and mosques. It has also been accused of firing rockets into southern Israel from densely populated areas such as Rafah and Beit Lahiya, which have led to numerous deaths and injuries.
In response to these alleged violations of international humanitarian law, Amnesty International has called on the international community to take action against Hamas and other armed groups operating in the Gaza Strip.
"We urge the international community to impose sanctions on those responsible for war crimes and crimes against humanity in the Gaza Strip," added Ms. Maalouf. "This should include the freezing of any assets they may have in countries where human rights abuses are taking place, as well as travel bans and arms embargoes. We also call on the UN Human Rights Council to establish an independent commission of inquiry to

input: As part of an effort to give applications more control over the infrastructure used to host them in the cloud, Riverbed Technology today at the Interop 2013 conference unveiled the Stingray Services Controller, a next-generation instance of the virtual application delivery controller (
continuation:
VADC).

Riverbeds new VADC is based on the same architecture as its previous version, but with some key changes. For one, it now offers support for Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) and Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3), making it easier for customers to move workloads to the cloud. It also has a new feature called Stingray Orchestrator, which lets customers orchestrate multiple instances of the VADC into a single cluster, so that they can scale up or down as needed.

In addition to EBS and S3 support, the new VADC will also offer support for Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), VMware vSphere, and OpenStack, among others.

We are excited to be able to offer our customers the ability to take advantage of the full breadth of services provided by Amazon EC2 and Amazon S3, said John Rizzo, senior vice president of product management at Riverbed. With this announcement, we are taking another important step towards enabling customers to

input: "Two Novelties in Russian Courts: Defense Lawyers and Jury Trials" (front page, May 11) reports that there are 50,000 lawyers in Russia, about half of them defense lawyers, many of them graduated from military or K.G.
continuation:
B. law schools. The number of jury trials has doubled in the last ten years.

This is not surprising, since it is much cheaper to hire a lawyer for a trial than it is to pay for an attorney who will represent you in a court of law. It also makes sense if you want to avoid the embarrassment of being found guilty by a jury of your peers, especially if you have been accused of a serious crime such as murder or rape.

The problem with hiring defense lawyers is that they can be very expensive. For example, according to one estimate, it costs more than $1,000 per hour to defend a criminal defendant in Moscow. This figure does not take into account the time spent waiting for the trial to start, or the cost of travel to and from the courthouse. In some cases, it may even be impossible to find a lawyer willing to take on the case at all.

In response to this situation, courts have begun to use alternative methods of selecting jurors, such as random selection from a pool of potential jurors. However, this method has its own problems, including the possibility of bias among those selected.

One way to solve this problem is to allow defense lawyers to present their clients

input: The industry veteran will be honored for his creative accomplishments with a 2013 Clio Lifetime Achievement Award in May. Here, he talks with Co.Create about fighting for your ideas, how to handle clients who dont appreciate good work, and putting
continuation:
yourself out there.

How did you first get involved in the design world?

I got into it when I was in high school. My parents were both graphic designers and my dad taught me how to use Illustrator and Photoshop. It wasnt until I went to college that I realized I could do this full-time.

What are some of the biggest challenges you face as a freelancer?

One of the biggest challenges is not being able to make enough money to support my family. Thats why Im working so hard to build my own business. Ive been doing this for over 20 years and Ive never had a day where I didnt feel like I was making a difference.

How do you deal with clients who arent appreciative of your work?

Its important to have a thick skin. If someone doesnt like what you do, they can go find another designer. You just have to keep moving forward.

What advice would you give to someone who wants to start their own business?

input:
A comeback story was crowned with a happy ending at Wimbledon on Saturday  but it was the revitalised Angelique Kerber rather than Serena Williams who lifted the trophy.
With the Duchesses of Sussex and Cambridge in the Royal Box and Tiger
continuation:
King star Joe Exotic in the stands, the crowd were treated to an electrifying match between two of the sports biggest stars.
Kerber had lost her last three matches at the All England Club before this years tournament, but she won 6-4 7-6 (7/3) in just under two hours to become the first German woman to win the title since Steffi Graf in 1988.
The 27-year-old said: Im very happy. I didnt know if I would be able to play here again. Its a dream come true for me.
It is the second Grand Slam title for Kerber, who also won the US Open in 2018, and she will go up against either Ashleigh Barty or Elina Svitolina in the semi-finals.
Williams has not won a major title since winning the 2017 Australian Open, while Barty has never been past the fourth round at Wimbledon.
But the 36-year-old former world number one showed no signs of rustiness as she fought back from a set down to beat Petra Kvitova 4-6 6-2 6

input:
Radio host Alan Chartock interviewed Gov. Cuomo on Thursday afternoon, just as he has on hundreds of occasions in the past.
It was a remarkable first.
Chartock, the most omnipresent voice on radio airwaves from Westchester to southern
continuation:
New Jersey, had never met the governor before.
The two men spoke for more than an hour about the coronavirus pandemic, its impact on New York and the state's economic future.
"We're all in this together," Cuomo said. "I'm going to do everything I can to make sure we get through this."
Cuomo, who is up for re-election next year, has emerged as one of the most powerful figures in American politics during the coronavirus pandemic.
His leadership has been praised by President Donald Trump, whose approval ratings are at their lowest level since the start of the pandemic.
But his popularity has also come under scrutiny, particularly after it was revealed that the governor's administration failed to properly prepare for the virus' spread in nursing homes.
On Wednesday, The Washington Post reported that the Department of Health and Human Services did not follow proper protocols when it came to nursing home deaths.
More than 6,700 people with COVID-19 were discharged from nursing homes into the general population between March and May, according to data released by the state health department last week.
New York State Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli, a Democrat, called the report "shocking

input:
Queen Elizabeth II delivered a Christmas Day speech to Britons about the importance of coming together and making sacrifices  but she apparently didnt put much thought into the decor.
The monarch was blasted for making the speech calling for self-sacrifice while
continuation:
her home is decked out in lavish holiday decorations, The Sun reported.
We should all be grateful that we live in a country where we are able to celebrate Christmas with our loved ones, the queen said. But this year more than any other, it has been a time when we have had to sacrifice so much in order to protect one another from the coronavirus pandemic.
She went on to say: In these difficult times, let us remember those who have lost their lives and give thanks for those who have survived. And let us commit ourselves to doing all we can to help everyone through this difficult period, by following the advice of the medical experts and staying at home as much as possible. Together we will overcome this, and when we do, we will be in a better place than we were a few short months ago.
However, Buckingham Palace did not immediately respond to Fox News' request for comment.

input:
The difficult dialogue began with a dark auditorium and a film screening, displaying the long history of the incarceration of African-Americans for the 80 students and community members in attendance.
The documentary, 13th, kept with the theme
continuation:
of racial injustice by focusing on the 13th Amendment, which abolished slavery and involuntary servitude but did not end it. It was passed in 1865, two years after President Abraham Lincoln signed the Emancipation Proclamation, freeing slaves who had been held as prisoners of war.
In 1868, the Supreme Court ruled that the 13th Amendment applied to all persons born in the United States, regardless of their race or place of origin. The ruling led to the imprisonment of hundreds of thousands of African-American men, women and children, many of whom were never charged with a crime.
We are here today because we have been denied our rights under the Constitution of the United States, said Rev. William Barber II, co-chair of the Poor Peoples Campaign, during his opening remarks.
Barber spoke about the importance of this years March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom, which will be held Aug. 28-29 at the National Mall in Washington, D.C.
This is an opportunity for us to come together and say, No more, he said. Its time to stand up and fight back against the

input:
Astounding? Or are you kind of afraid of a robot takeover now?
Gymnasts dreaming of a future Olympic win might find they have some competition  the robot kind.
Waltham-based Boston Dynamics shared a video Thursday of
continuation:
its latest creation, SpotMini, which is designed to assist people with everyday tasks such as picking up objects and carrying them to their destinations.
The company's previous creations include Atlas, a humanoid robot that can run, jump and climb stairs. It was also featured in the film "Jurassic World," where it was used to help protect the park from dinosaurs.
SpotMini is smaller than those robots, but still has enough power to move around on its own.
"We've been working on this for about three years, and we're really excited to finally share it with the world," said co-founder Marc Raibert in a news release. "We hope it will be a useful tool for anyone who wants to help themselves or someone else."
It's not the first time Boston Dynamics has shown off SpotMini. In 2017, the company showed off the robot at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas, Nevada. At the time, the robot could pick up items weighing less than 5 pounds and carry them up two flights of stairs.
But SpotMini isn't just a toy. The company plans to use SpotMini in hospitals, assisted living facilities and other places where people may need assistance.

input:
Liverpool have submitted a bid for Real Madrid's Karim Benzema.
Several sources in Spain have suggested that Reds boss Brendan Rodgers submitted a bid in the region of 50m for the French international, who joined Real in 2010, earlier today.
continuation:
The 27-year-old has been linked with a move away from the Bernabeu this summer after failing to agree a new contract at the club.
Rodgers will be keen to bolster his attacking options ahead of next season and is believed to have identified Benzema as a potential replacement for Luis Suarez.
However, it remains to be seen whether or not Los Blancos will be willing to let their star man leave.
Benzema has scored 118 goals in 292 appearances for Real since joining from Ligue 1 giants Paris Saint-Germain seven years ago.

input:
Cleveland-Cliffs isn't the company it once was, but Wall Street is still pricing it that way.
For years, iron ore producer Cleveland-Cliffs (NYSE:CLF) has been in the midst of a turnaround plan
continuation:
to turn around its business and return to profitability. It's had some success in doing so, but the stock hasn't done much better. Shares are down more than 60% over the past five years.
Continue Reading Below
But investors have been willing to pay a premium for what they thought would be a turnaround story. The stock trades at a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of roughly 30 times this year's forecast earnings. That's well above the average P/E for the S&P 500, which currently sits at about 20 times earnings.
Image source: Getty Images.
Investors aren't giving up on Cleveland-Cliffs just yet. In fact, they're buying into the idea that the company can continue to improve its operations and become profitable again.
Why the optimism?
There are several reasons why investors are optimistic about Cleveland-Cliffs' future prospects. First, there's the company's strong balance sheet. As of the end of the second quarter, it had $2.3 billion in cash and short-term investments, along with $1.5 billion in undrawn credit facilities.

North American Palladium (PAL) is dropping on Wednesday, adding to losses suffered since the beginning of the week.
Amid choppy markets in correction mode, the secret to making it in the long run is having the patience and fortitude to
continuation:
ride out the ups and downs that come with investing in precious metals. Thats exactly what North American Palladium Corp. (TSXV: PAL)(OTCQB: PALDF) has been doing so far this year.
The Toronto-based company recently announced that it has entered into a non-brokered private placement for gross proceeds of $2.5 million. The funds will be used to fund exploration activities at its 100%-owned El Dorado project in Nevada, as well as for general working capital purposes.
PAL shares are currently trading at $0.15 per share on the TSX Venture Exchange (TSXV), down from a recent high of $0.20. The stock has lost more than 50% of its value over the past 12 months.
Heres why you should consider buying North American Palladium now.
Investing in palladium
Palladium is an industrial metal used in catalytic converters to reduce harmful emissions from diesel and gasoline engines. It also finds use in other applications, such as in electric vehicles.
According to the International Energy Agency (IEA), global demand for palladium is expected to increase by 10% annually through 2040.

input: Former Kent State wrestling coach Ron Gray will be inducted into the National Wrestling Hall of Fame on June 1 in Stillwater, Okla. Gray, who coached the Golden Flashes for 25 seasons, is one of four members who will be inducted
continuation:
this year.

The other three inductees are former University of Minnesota wrestler and two-time Olympic gold medalist John Bones Thompson, former University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill head coach Bob McKillop, and former University of Oklahoma head coach Eddie Gaedel. The induction ceremony will take place at 6:30 p.m. ET on Saturday, June 1, at the Hilton Garden Inn & Suites in Stillwater. Tickets are $50 per person and can be purchased online or by calling (800) 745-3000. All proceeds from ticket sales will go to benefit the American Cancer Society.

In addition to his coaching duties, Gray served as an assistant coach with the U.S. national team during the 1988 Olympics in Seoul, South Korea. He was a member of the U.S. team that won the bronze medal at the 1989 Pan American Games in San Juan, Puerto Rico.

Gray began his coaching career at Ohio Wesleyan University, where he spent five years before moving to Kent State. During his time at Kent State, he led the Golden Flashes to three NCAA Division II national championships (1991, 1992, 1993).

He also had stints at

input:
QUITO, ECUADOREcuador election officials have agreed to recount nearly 1.3 million votes as opposition leader Guillermo Lasso continues to allege fraud in the presidential election.
The National Electoral Council announced late Thursday it would
continuation:
hold a second round of voting on June 7 after an initial tally showed President Lenin Moreno with a narrow lead over his main rival, former president Rafael Correa.
Lasso says hes ready to accept the results if they show there was no fraud.
The vote count is being closely watched because it will determine which party controls Ecuadors next government.
Correa has refused to concede defeat and has vowed to challenge the results in court.

input:
Ms Lee, 45, an avid jogger, had been jogging almost every day for the past five years. Recently, her knees started to hurt.
Gradually, walking up and down the stairs became a problem too, so much so that
continuation:
she could no longer do it.
"I was in pain all the time," she told The Straits Times. "I couldn't go out of the house anymore."
She sought help from physiotherapists and orthopaedic surgeons at Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH) and Nanyang Technological University (NTU), who diagnosed her with osteoarthritis (OA).
The OA is a degenerative joint disease caused by wear and tear on the cartilage that cushions the bones in the joints.
It can be treated with medication or surgery, depending on the severity of the condition.
In Ms Lee's case, she underwent knee arthroscopy, a minimally invasive surgical procedure that involves cutting through the bone to remove the damaged cartilage.
After three months of treatment, she was able to return to her regular exercise routine.
But she still found herself unable to walk more than a few metres without getting tired.
So last month, she went back to TTSH for a second opinion.
"They told me I have osteoarthritis in my left knee, and they recommended that I undergo a total knee replacement," she said, adding that she

input:

Two men wearing hoods and masks were reported to have broken into the station at the Milton Tesco on Cambridge Road.

The incident happened just after 11am this morning.

March 27 - A greater proportion of quota places for women is among the changes successfully proposed by the World Rowing Federation (FISA) to its qualification system ahead of Rio 2016.
The changes, which have now been approved by the International Olympic Committee
continuation:
(IOC), will be implemented from 2017 onwards.
In a statement released on Wednesday, FISA said it was "pleased" with the outcome of the meeting in Lausanne, Switzerland, where the organisation's executive board voted unanimously to approve the changes.
They are designed to ensure that more female rowers are able to compete at the highest level, as well as providing an opportunity for those who do not qualify through the world rankings.
The new rules include:
- An increase in the number of quotas allocated to each national federation based on the results of the previous year.
- The introduction of gender-specific quotas for men and women's single sculls and coxless fours.
- The introduction of gender-specific quotas for men's and women's double sculls and coxless fours.
- The introduction of gender-specific quotas for men's and women's eights.
- The introduction of gender-specific quotas for men's and women's eight-person keelboat.
- The introduction of gender-specific quotas for men's and women's lightweight double sculls.
- The introduction of gender-specific quotas for men's and women's lightweight double scull

input:
Shock jock facing lawsuit from player on the Rutgers Women's basketball team.
Don Imus is facing his first lawsuit from a player on the Rutgers Women's Basketball team for derogatory comments that cost him his job as a radio host in April, ABC
continuation:
News has learned.
The suit was filed in New Jersey Superior Court in Newark on Tuesday and names Imus' former employer, WFAN, as a defendant along with two unnamed female employees of the station. It alleges that Imus made "derogatory remarks" about the Rutgers women's basketball team during a live broadcast in which he called them "nappy-headed hos."
Imus has denied making any such comments.
In a statement provided to ABC News, Imus said, "I want to make it clear that I did not call these young women nappy-headed hoes, nor have I ever done so in my life." He added, "I will defend myself vigorously against this meritless lawsuit and look forward to vindicating my good name in court."
WFAN declined to comment when reached by ABC News. The station's parent company, iHeartMedia, also did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
The lawsuit comes just days after Imus announced he would be leaving the airwaves after more than 30 years at the top of the country's most listened-to sports talk radio show. He had been suspended without pay following an internal investigation into allegations of inappropriate comments he made about

input:
CATEGORY five cyclones are not meant to exist.
They are a way of terrifying children in Central Queensland into making sure they are not running outside or playing in open drains during the summer wet.
Growing up in Mackay, cycl
continuation:
one season was never far from my mind.
I remember being woken up at 3am by my dad on the morning of Cyclone Yasi, which hit the coast just south of Cairns.
He told me it was the worst storm he'd ever seen, and I can't imagine what it must have been like for those who were directly affected.
Cyclone Yasi hit the coast just south of Cairns. ( Supplied: National Parks and Wildlife Service )
My father is no longer with us, but I still think about him every time I see a cyclone approaching.
It's one of the reasons why I'm so passionate about protecting our natural environment.
So when I heard that the Bureau of Meteorology had issued a severe thunderstorm warning for the Mackay region, I knew I had to get out there and find out what was happening.
The Bureau of Meteorology has issued a severe thunderstorm warning for the Mackay region. ( ABC Capricornia: James Davenport )
What is a cyclone?
A cyclone is a large weather system that forms over the ocean.
These storms move slowly across the surface of the water, causing heavy rain, strong winds

input:
Texas has become the first state in the nation to require law enforcement to obtain a warrant to read people's email, and privacy advocates are hoping the move will help quicken the passage of a similar proposal in Congress.
Texas Gov. Rick Perry signed
continuation:
an executive order on Wednesday that requires police to get a judge's approval before searching through someone's email or text messages.
The Texas Tribune thanks its sponsors. Become one.
"This is about protecting your right to privacy," Perry said during a signing ceremony at the Texas Department of Public Safety headquarters in Austin. "If you have something to hide, don't send it over the Internet."
The bill was approved by the Legislature earlier this year but stalled in the final days of the legislative session as lawmakers focused on other issues. It now heads to Perry's desk, where he plans to sign it into law.
Privacy advocates say the measure is a step in the right direction, but they're still looking for stronger protections against mass surveillance.
"It's a good start, but I think we can do better," said Jennifer Granholm, executive director of the American Civil Liberties Union of Texas. "We need to be much more careful about what we're doing with our personal information."
Granholm said she would like to see laws requiring companies to disclose when their customers' data is shared with third-parties. She also wants to see limits placed on government agencies' ability to access emails and texts without a warrant.

input:
The 509th Civil Engineer Squadron re-opened the Atlantis Hall dormitory in March 2019 after a year and a half of renovations at Whiteman Air Force Base, Missouri.
The renovations completely overhauled the building and will be the standard for the
continuation:
next decade.
We are very proud to have been able to complete this project on time and within budget, said Lt. Col. David Rupp, 491st Civil Engineering Squadron commander. This is a great example of how we can work together as a team to achieve our common goal of providing a safe and comfortable living environment for the men and women who train with us every day.
The squadrons mission is to provide civil engineering services to the U.S. Armed Forces and its allies worldwide.

input:
Agency Geek is looking to help business relationships blossom.
A new business matchmaking company that describes itself as the "first and only" service that uses algorithmic science to match businesses with with advertising, PR, branding and web-development firms
continuation:
has launched in New York City.
The agency, which was founded by a group of former executives at Google, Yahoo and AOL, says it will use data from more than 100 different sources  including LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Yelp and other social media platforms, as well as search engines like Google, Bing and Yahoo!  to help clients find the right fit for their marketing needs.
"We're really focused on finding the best matches," said CEO and co-founder David Gewirtz. "It's all about matching the right people with the right opportunities."
Gewirtz and his co-founders have been working on the idea for the past two years. The startup has raised $2.5 million in venture capital funding, according to Crunchbase.
In its first few months of operation, Agency Geek has signed up more than 50 clients, ranging from startups to Fortune 500 companies. Clients include e-commerce site Bonobos, luxury fashion retailer Net-a-Porter, online travel company Priceline Group and insurance company AIG.
"Our goal is to be the go-to resource for brands who are looking to expand their reach," Gewirtz said. "We want to help

input: The big news on any day when President Bush delivers a "major address" regarding Iraq is never what the commander-in-chief says. Bush has been on autopilot for so long now that he does not even bother to say anything new -- even
continuation:
if it's true.

This week, Bush delivered his annual State of the Union address. It was the first time he had spoken in public since Sept. 11, 2001, and he made no mention of the war in Iraq.

Instead, he talked about America's economic recovery from the Great Recession and the need to protect Social Security and Medicare.

Bush said the U.S. economy will grow by 3 percent this year, up from an estimated 2.2 percent growth last year. He also noted that the unemployment rate is at a record low of 4.1 percent.

But Bush didn't talk about the war in Iraq.

In fact, there were very few mentions of Iraq during his speech.

Here are some of the highlights:

On Afghanistan: "We're making progress against al-Qaida and other terrorist groups."

On Iran: "I'm confident we can reach a nuclear agreement with Iran without compromising our national security interests."

On North Korea: "We continue to urge China to use its influence over North Korea to rein in its nuclear weapons program."

On terrorism: "Terrorism is a threat to all of us. We have to work together

input: The 2012-13 campaign has been anything but good to them, but the Boston Celtics will forge ahead Thursday, hoping to squeeze any semblance of positivity out of a midseason date with their historic rival, the Los Angeles Lakers. Get NBA odds for
continuation:
tonights game at SportsLine.

Boston has won just three of its last 11 games and is in danger of missing the playoffs for the first time since 2008. The Celtics have lost by an average of 17.5 points per game during the skid, and they havent scored more than 90 points in a game since Jan. 13 against the Philadelphia 76ers.

Lakers coach Mike DAntoni said after Wednesdays practice that he expects his team to play with a chip on our shoulder. He added: I dont know if were going to win, but I think its going to be a hard-fought game. Weve got a lot of young guys who are playing really well right now.  Itll be a good test for us.

The Celtics are coming off a 122-114 loss to the Miami Heat on Monday night, in which Rajon Rondo (knee) and Avery Bradley (ankle) both missed their second straight game.

Bradley is expected to return to the lineup Thursday, while Rondo is still considered day-to

input:
This years World Cup official ball will be the Telstar 18, a modern interpretation of the 1970 and 1974 adidas ball, Telstar.
The name was coined due to its black and white pentagons that made it easier to spot
continuation:
from a distance. The Telstar 18 has been developed in partnership with Adidas and is being used for the first time at this years tournament in Russia.
The ball features an all-aluminum casing with a polyurethane inner core. It also includes a new Dynamo logo on the back of the ball.
Adidas says the ball is more durable than previous versions thanks to the use of high-density polyethylene (HDPE) and a special material called TPU, or thermoplastic urethane.
We are very pleased to have been able to work closely with our partners at Adidas and provide them with a ball that they can be proud of for many years to come," said FIFA president Gianni Infantino. "I am confident that the Telstar 18 will be a key part of the success of the Russian 2018 World Cup."
FIFA says the ball will be available for pre-order starting next week.

input:
A group of stock traders teamed with two Ukrainian-based computer hackers to make $100 million in illegal profits by gaining access to hundreds of press releases of many leading U.S. companies and trading on the stolen news before it became public.
All
continuation:
told, they made more than $1 billion over a three-year period, according to court documents unsealed this week in Manhattan federal court.
The case is one of the most high-profile cases brought by Special Counsel Robert Muellers investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election. It also marks the first time prosecutors have publicly alleged that an organized crime syndicate used social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook to spread disinformation and manipulate public opinion.
Prosecutors allege that from at least 2014 to 2017, members of the DarkSide cybercrime group hacked into computers belonging to companies including JPMorgan Chase & Co., Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc., United Parcel Service Inc., Home Depot Inc., Macys Inc., Verizon Communications Inc., and others. The hackers then posted the stolen information online for free.
In some instances, the hackers gained access to tens of thousands of pages of internal company documents. In others, they were able to obtain millions of dollars worth of trade secrets or other confidential business information.
Some of the stolen material was later published on websites controlled by DarkSide. Others were shared through encrypted messaging services such as Signal, WhatsApp, Telegram, and WeChat.
According to the indictment,

This is a preview of a research report from BI Intelligence, Business Insider's premium research service. Click here to learn more.
In an increasingly digital economy, banks are becoming more dependent on efficient data processing to improve customer service and products, and ensure
continuation:
compliance with new regulations such as the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (Dodd-Frank).
But in order to do this, they need access to large amounts of data that can help them make better predictions about customers' needs and preferences.
To meet these demands, many banks are turning to artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) technologies, which use computer algorithms to analyze vast amounts of data to predict what customers will want in the future.
For example, Bank of America (NYSE: BAC), JPMorgan Chase (NYSE: JPM), Wells Fargo (NYSE: WFC), and Citigroup (NYSE: C) have all invested heavily in AI and ML technologies over the past few years.
Here are three reasons why investors should keep an eye out for investment opportunities in the financial services sector.

Banks have long been known for being slow to adapt to changes in consumer behavior, but they're starting to catch up fast.

input:
Andy Farrell looks set to leave Saracens to take up a full-time position with England following the appointment of Stuart Lancaster as head coach, Telegraph Sport understands.
Lancaster was named as permanent successor to Martin Johnson on Thursday following a Rugby
continuation:
Football Union (RFU) board meeting at Twickenham.
Farrell is understood to have turned down an offer from Premiership rivals Exeter Chiefs to join them on a three-year deal, which would have paid him around 1m a year.
The former Leinster and Ireland scrum-half has also been approached by a number of European clubs, including French giants Toulon and Racing 92, who are both in the market for a new head coach after Jacques Brunel resigned earlier this week.
Farrell's departure comes just days after Saracens were found guilty of breaching salary cap regulations for the 2017-18 season. The club will be deducted 20 points and fined 500,000.
Saracens are appealing against the ruling, but it is expected that they will be stripped of their title and relegated to the second-tier Championship next season.
"We are disappointed to lose Andy," said Saracens chief executive Mark McCall. "He has done a fantastic job since he took over last summer and we wish him every success in his future endeavours.
"I would like to thank all of our staff and players for their hard work and dedication over the past 12 months. We

input:
LIVERPOOL boss Jurgen Klopp has hinted that the club are set to tie Joe Gomez down to a new bumper contract.
Reports have been circulating this week that England defender Gomez will soon be rewarded for his recent good form with a vastly
continuation:
improved deal, which would see him earn 100,000-a-week.
Getty Images - Getty 3 Gomez is one of Liverpools most important players
Klopp said: I dont know anything about that, but I can tell you that he is very happy here and we all want him to stay as long as possible.
Gomez has played every minute so far this season in an injury-plagued campaign.
The 24-year-old made his first appearance since October last year when he came on as a second-half substitute in the 2-0 win over Burnley at Turf Moor on Saturday.
AFP or licensors 3 Gomez was forced to miss the start of the season after suffering a serious knee ligament injury in pre-season
But he has not featured regularly since then due to ongoing problems with his ankle.
Klopp added: "He had a few weeks where he didn't train, but now he's back in full training.
"We're really pleased with him. He looks like he's in really good shape.
GETTY IMAGES - GETTY 3 Klopp says Gomez is in really good shape

input:
Driverless buses and other city vehicles will follow in the trailblazing path of an autonomous shuttle soon to run between the Calgary Zoo and Telus Spark, a city councillor said Thursday.
The 12-passenger Electronic Autonomous shuttle, or E
continuation:
AS, is being developed by Vancouver-based startup Zoox. Its expected to start operating on public transit routes this summer.
Councillor Jeromy Farkas, who represents the area where the zoo is located, said hes excited about the potential for automated shuttles to help alleviate traffic congestion.
I think its going to be a game-changer, Farkas said. Were going to see more and more of these things pop up all over the place.
Farkas added that hes been impressed with Zooxs progress so far.
Theyve done a fantastic job, he said. Im looking forward to seeing what they can do in the next couple of years.
Zoox was founded in 2013 by former Google engineer Anthony Levandowski. The company has raised nearly $200 million in venture capital since its founding.
Levandowski left Google last year to form his own self-driving vehicle startup called Otto. He later sold Otto to Uber for $680 million.
A spokesperson for Zoox did not immediately respond

input:
Not only does Comcast careit also knows what you think.
The company is well aware of the fact that it has maintained one of corporate Americas worst reputations for several years by scoring near the bottom in pretty much every category from
continuation:
customer satisfaction to workplace culture, according to a new survey by Consumer Reports.
In the report, titled Comcast: The Worst Company to Work For, the consumer advocacy group surveyed more than 2,000 people about their experiences with Comcast and other major U.S. cable companies, including Charter Communications, Time Warner Cable, and AT&T U-verse.
The survey found that Comcast was the worst company to work for out of all the companies it surveyed. It ranked last in terms of employee engagement, followed by Charter at No. 3, and Time Warner Cable (No. 4) and AT&T at No. 5 and No. 6, respectively.
Consumer Reports said its findings are based on surveys conducted over the past two years.
We know that many of us have been unhappy with our cable provider for some time now, and we hope this report will help consumers make informed decisions about which providers they choose when it comes time to sign up for service, Consumer Reports President and CEO Gary Shapiro said in a statement.
Its no secret that the cable industry isnt doing itself any favors when it comes to customer satisfaction, he added.

input:
AFL-CIO calls for urgent action to stop Indiana "right-to-work"
The AFL-CIO has issued a national appeal for help to stop passage of a so-called right-to-work law
continuation:
in Indiana, which would allow workers to opt out of paying union dues.
Indiana Governor Mike Pence (R) is expected to sign the bill into law on Thursday, making it the first right-to-work state in the U.S.
In a statement released Wednesday, the AFL-CIO said:
Right-to-work laws are bad for working people and their families. They undermine collective bargaining rights, make it more difficult for unions to organize, and drive down wages and benefits for all workers. It's no surprise that the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME) and the National Education Association (NEA) have been among the most vocal opponents of right-to-work legislation. The AFL-CIO stands with these two powerful unions as they fight back against this attack on labor rights. We call on our members and allies to join us in standing up to right-to-work in Indiana by contacting your elected officials and urging them to oppose right-to-work legislation.
AFL-CIO President Richard Trumka told reporters at a press conference Wednesday morning that he was concerned about the impact of right-to-work in other states.
"I am very

input: (Newser)  The US is still flying Boeing 737 Max 8 planes, despite a growing number of nations grounding them following two crashes in less than five months. (NPR is keeping track of the countries and airlines that have grounded the planes so far
continuation:
.)

The Federal Aviation Administration says its not aware of any reports of incidents or injuries associated with the use of these aircraft in the United States, according to a statement from the agency. It adds that it will continue to closely monitor the situation as more information becomes available. A spokesman for the FAA declined to comment further on the matter, citing privacy concerns. (Read more Boeing 737 Max stories.)

Canada's Transport Minister Marc Garneau told reporters today that his country has "no plans at this point" to ground the planes. "We're not going to take any action until we've got all the facts," he said. "We want to make sure we do everything we can to get to the bottom of what happened." He added: "I don't think there's anything to be concerned about right now." (Read more Boeing 737 Max stories.)

 With reporting by the Associated Press

input:
Ten years after al-Qaeda first surfaced, the US is still at war with "terrorist" groups.
In a neatly manicured garden in Nairobi, Joash Okindo limps towards a marble plaque erected in honour of those who
continuation:
lost their lives on 9/11. It reads: "On this day 10 years ago, September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks took place in New York City and Washington, D.C., killing nearly 3,000 people and injuring more than 6,000 others."
Okindo is here to pay his respects to the victims, but he also wants to make a point. "I think it's important that we don't forget," he says. "We should not be complacent about what happened on 9/11. We should not let our guard down."
It is a sentiment shared by many around the world as they mark the anniversary of the worst terror attack on American soil since World War II. The United States has been fighting terrorism ever since al-Qaeda was founded in Afghanistan in the mid-1990s by Osama bin Laden, whose group was blamed for orchestrating the 9/11 attacks.
Since then, there have been several attempts to kill or capture Bin Laden, including an attempted raid in Pakistan last year that ended in a shootout between US special forces and members of Al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent (AQIS), which claimed responsibility for the attack.
But despite all the setbacks, the US

input:
TANYA NOLAN: The biggest medical conference Australia has ever seen is about to descend on Melbourne in a few weeks time.
AIDS 2014 will attract 14,000 of the world's leading HIV scientists, policymakers and activists to discuss progress on
continuation:
the global AIDS epidemic.
The event will be held at the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre from February 28-March 1.
This year marks the 20th anniversary of the first World Health Organization (WHO) conference on AIDS, which was held in Geneva, Switzerland, in December 1988.
Since then, more than 10 million people have been infected with HIV and an estimated 3.2 million people are living with the virus today.
Australia is one of the countries most affected by HIV/AIDS.
According to the latest Australian Bureau of Statistics data, there were 2,738 new HIV diagnoses in the 12 months ending June 2013.
Of those diagnosed, 1,941 were men who have sex with men.
More than half of all new HIV infections occur among gay and bisexual men aged between 15 and 49 years old.
In Victoria, there were 751 new HIV diagnoses in the 12 months ending June 2013.
Of those diagnosed, 622 were gay and bisexual men aged between 15 and 49 years old.
In New South Wales, there were 476 new HIV diagnoses in the 12 months ending June 2013.
Of those diagnosed, 539 were gay and bisexual men aged between 15 and 49 years old.

input:
Daniel R. Welsh, 60, of Williamsfield, OH, died Sunday, October 20, 2013, at his home.
Born March 22, 1953, in Pittsburgh, a son of Shirley L. (Gregory) Vidonic, Aliqu
continuation:
ippa, PA, and the late Robert J. Welsh.
He was employed as a machinist by General Motors for over 30 years.
Survivors include two sons, Daniel R. Welsh Jr., Williamsfield, OH, and David A. Welsh, Williamsfield, OH; three daughters, Karen M. Welsh, Williamsfield, OH, Susan B. Welsh, Williamsfield, OH, and Lisa C. Welsh, Williamsfield, OH; seven grandchildren; and five great-grandchildren.
In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by a sister, Mary Ann Welsh.
Friends will be received from 4:00  7:00 p.m. Thursday, October 24, 2013, at the WESTBROOK FUNERAL HOME INC., 615 N. Main St., Williamsfield, OH, where services will be held at 11:00 a.m. Friday, October 25, 2013, with Rev. John D. Smith officiating. Burial will follow in the Williamsfield Cemetery.
Memorial contributions may be made to the American Diabetes Association, P.O. Box 973018, Atlanta, GA 30326-9018.

input:
The narrow road to the compound, the temporary home to the US officials, remained blocked by security guards. A security official cited an "important private event" there.
The two sides are in Singapore apparently to discuss the logistical details of the summit talks
continuation:
between President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, which will take place on June 12 at the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) that divides the two Koreas.
Trump said earlier this month that he would be willing to sit down with Kim without preconditions, but only if North Korea takes concrete steps toward denuclearization.
North Korea has repeatedly said it is not interested in giving up its nuclear weapons and missile programs unless the United States removes its 28,500 troops stationed in South Korea.
In a statement carried by the state-run KCNA news agency, Foreign Ministry spokesman Geng Shuang reiterated Pyongyang's call for the United States to withdraw its troops from the Korean peninsula.
"We urge the U.S. side to immediately cease all hostile acts against our country," Geng said, according to Reuters.
Geng did not specify what those hostile acts were.
South Korean President Moon Jae-in also called for the withdrawal of American troops from the Korean peninsula during a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing on Friday, according to Yonhap News Agency.
China is North Korea's main ally and economic lifeline.
Moon also urged China to use its influence over North Korea to

input:
Nigerians are hoping for a win as the Super Eagles meet Croatia on Saturday (today) in their first match at the 2018 FIFA World Cup in Russia.
Both teams are placed alongside Argentina and Iceland in Group D of the tournament.
The
continuation:
game will be played at Moscows Luzhniki Stadium, which is named after Soviet dictator Josef Stalin.
Croatia defeated Nigeria 1-0 in a friendly match in October last year.
Nigeria coach Gernot Rohr has made three changes to his starting line-up from the side that drew 2-2 with Iceland last week.
Midfielder Kelechi Iheanacho replaces Victor Osimhen while Alex Iwobi drops to the bench.
Odion Ighalo, who scored the winning goal against Iceland, comes back into the starting line-up.
Nigeria have not won a major international trophy since lifting the Africa Cup of Nations title in 2013.
They were knocked out of the 2016 European Championship by eventual winners France.
Meanwhile, Croatia coach Zlatko Dalic said his team had prepared well for the game.
We know what we need to do to get a positive result, Dalic told reporters.
I am very satisfied with our preparation. We have done everything possible to prepare for this match.
Its going to be an important game for us. We are looking forward to it

input:
UTEP beat Rice with a score of 34-26, breaking the longest losing streak in the country.
Even when UTEP bolted out to a 34-3 lead Saturday against hapless Rice, even when every ball bounced their way and the 20
continuation:
th-ranked Miners looked like they were going to cruise to an easy win, there was still one more game to play.
And thats where things got interesting.
Rice came storming back late in the fourth quarter, scoring 10 straight points to cut UTEPs lead to just three points. The Miners responded with a touchdown drive of their own, capped by a 1-yard run from junior running back Jashaun Corbin, but the Owls would not go away.
They scored two touchdowns on the next two possessions, cutting UTEPs lead to six points with less than four minutes left.
But then it happened.
Corbin scored his second touchdown of the game, this time from 3 yards out with 2:10 remaining to give UTEP its first lead of the game at 35-26.
It wasnt until the final seconds of the game, however, that Rice had a chance to tie or win the game.
On third down, senior quarterback Dontavius Russell tried to throw a pass into the end zone, only to have the ball bounce off his hand and right into the hands of sophomore safety Jaquan Brisker.

Heres a fantastic movie idea: Tropic Thunder takes place on the set of a big-budget Hollywood Vietnam War film also entitled Tropic Thunder.
With a finicky A-list cast causing endless delays in shooting, the studio orders
continuation:
an all-star crew to take over the production and make it look as authentic as possible.
The result is one of the funniest comedies ever made.
Im not sure how I feel about this. On the one hand, it sounds like a great way to spend a few hours with some of my favorite actors, but at the same time, I dont know if I could handle that level of commitment for more than two or three days out of the year.
But hey, if you can pull it off, then by all means go for it.

input:
Like a wave breaking against the shore, it was over in a moment.
But in that moment - noon Saturday - more than 240 people stood at the water's edge in Atlantic and Neptune Beach, clasping each other's hands, united in their
continuation:
desire to help those who had been affected by Hurricane Florence.
The storm, which made landfall as a Category 1 hurricane on Friday night, has left behind a trail of destruction along its path through the Carolinas.
In North Carolina alone, at least 23 deaths have been attributed to the storm.
"We're here to help," said one man holding a sign with the words "We Are All One" written on it. "We are all in this together."
A few feet away, another man held a sign that read: "I Love My Neighbor."
"It's not just about me," he said. "This is bigger than me. This is bigger than my house. This is bigger than my car. This is bigger than anything I own. This is bigger than anything I've ever seen before. And we're going to be OK. We're going to get back up and we're going to move forward."
More than two dozen volunteers from around the country gathered in the parking lot of St. Paul United Methodist Church in Ocean Isle Beach, N.C., where they were joined by dozens of local church members and others.
Volunteers from New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Virginia, Ohio, Texas and

input:
In a late season tuneup for the postseason push next week, the Hudson competitive cheer team won the Division 4 title and took second overall at the Saline Invitational on Saturday.
The Tigers posted a total score of 738.44 with a
continuation:
first-place finish in the varsity division.
Hudsons senior co-captains, Kaitlyn Schumacher (varsity) and Kayla Stauffer (varsity), were named to the all-tournament team.
The Tigers also placed third in the junior varsity division with a score of 695.75.
Hudson will be back in action on Tuesday when it travels to Grand Rapids Catholic Central for a 5:30 p.m. contest.

Coach shortages that have caused overcrowding on the commuter rail will persist until for a few more weeks, officials said Monday.
The shortage of coaches that has caused overcrowding on the commuter rail will persist until mid-May, officials said Monday.
continuation:
Were not going to be able to get back to where we were in terms of the number of coaches we had before the pandemic, Metropolitan Transportation Authority Executive Director Patrick Foye said during a news conference at Grand Central Terminal.
He said the agency is working with Amtrak and New Jersey Transit to fill the gaps, but it will take time.
Its going to take a while, he said. I dont know exactly how long, but I can tell you its not going to be this week or next week or the week after that.
Foye said the MTA is looking into options such as hiring additional staff to help manage the situation. He also said the agency is considering moving some trains to other stations to free up space.
Amtrak spokesman Marc Magliari said in an email that the company is continuing to work closely with our partners at the MTA to address any issues they may be experiencing.

He is survived by his sons, Michael Burkus and his wife, Linda, of Ambridge and David Burkus and his wife, Susan, of Ambridge; grandchildren, Matthew Burkus and his fiancee, Amanda, of Ambridge, Sarah Burkus and her husband, Jason, of New Castle, and Joshua Burkus and his fiance, Ashley, of Ambridge; great-grandchildren, Logan Burkus, Lillian Burkus, and Addison Burkus; and many nieces, nephews, other relatives and friends.
In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by his daughter, Patricia Burkus; and brother, James Burkus.

input:
The Best Buy logo on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in New York on Nov. 12, 2018.
In naming Corie Barry chief executive officer, Best Buy Co. hands the reins to the architect of its current growth strategy, widely
continuation:
credited with turning around the struggling electronics retailer.
Barry will take over from Richard Schulze, who announced his retirement earlier this month. Barry has spent more than two decades at the company, most recently serving as senior vice president and general manager for North America.
Best Buy's shares rose 1.4% in after-hours trading following the announcement. The stock is up nearly 20% so far this year.
"Corie brings a wealth of knowledge and experience to our leadership team," CEO Hubert Joly said in a statement. "We are confident that she will continue to build on the strong foundation we have built together."
Barry, 55, has been with Best Buy since 1998, according to her LinkedIn profile. She previously served as senior vice president of merchandising for the Americas, where she was responsible for the company's U.S. consumer electronics business.
Prior to joining Best Buy, Barry worked at Gap Inc.'s Old Navy chain. She holds a bachelor's degree in business administration from the University of Notre Dame and an MBA from the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania.
Barry succeeds Richard Schulze, who announced his retirement earlier this month. (Photo:

input:
Helen Epstein reports in The New York Review of Books (excerpt below) on the death of Ms. Cerinah Nebanda, a fearless young member of Parliament who challenged Gen. Museveni in Uganda over corruption.
It
continuation:
s hard to believe that it was only last year that I interviewed Ms. Nebanda for an article about her life and work as a human rights activist in Uganda. She was then just 26 years old. Now she is dead.
Ms. Nebanda was killed by unknown assailants while returning home from a meeting with government officials. Her body has not been found.
The murder comes at a time when Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni is facing increasing international pressure over his alleged role in the killing of anti-corruption crusader Mr. Robert Kyagulanyi Ssentamu, better known as Bobi Wine. Mr. Museveni denies any involvement.
Ms. Nebanda was one of the few people who dared to speak out against corruption under Mr. Musevenis rule. I dont care if you are my friend or not, she told me. If you are corrupt, you must be held accountable. You cannot get away with it.
Ms. Nebanda was born in the small town of Kasese, where she grew up with her parents and five siblings. She went to secondary school in Mbarara, the capital of

input:
Traffic deaths in California fell 9 percent last year  the biggest drop in 14 years  and crashes on Highway 17 continued their nearly decadelong decline.
State officials attribute the decline in road-related deaths statewide to more Californians wearing their seat
continuation:
belts, better enforcement of traffic laws and a reduction in alcohol-impaired driving.
The state Department of Motor Vehicles reported Friday that there were 3,946 traffic fatalities in 2016, down from 4,049 in 2015. Thats the lowest number since 2005.
The number of people killed or injured in traffic accidents has been declining steadily over the past decade. The number of traffic fatalities in 2014 was the lowest in more than two decades.
The number of people killed or injured in traffic accidents has been declining steadily over the past decade. (Photo: CONTRIBUTED PHOTO BY CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES)
We are encouraged by the progress we have made in reducing fatal and serious injury collisions on our roads, said DMV Director Jean Shiomoto in a statement. We will continue to work with local law enforcement and other stakeholders to make sure everyone wears their seat belt, drives sober and obeys the speed limit.
California is one of the nations most heavily regulated states when it comes to traffic safety. It requires drivers to wear seat belts in cars, trucks and SUVs, as well as all passenger vehicles

Here's a list at Indianapolis-area splash pads and pools to help you stay cool throughout the summer.
Summer temperatures may leave you looking for a place to cool off across the Indianapolis area and there are plenty of options.
Indy Parks boasts
continuation:
more than 100 splash pads and pools in the city, including some that are open year-round.
If you're looking for an indoor pool, look no further than Fountain Square Aquatic Center, which is open seven days a week from 11 a.m. to 7 p.m.
You can also check out the aquatic center's website or Facebook page for more information on its hours of operation.
Fountain Square Aquatic Center is located at 1201 N. Meridian St., Indianapolis, IN 46215.
The Indiana Dunes National Lakeshore offers free admission to all visitors ages 3 and older. The national park also offers free admission to children ages 2 and younger if accompanied by a paying adult.
There are two swimming areas at the Indiana Dunes National Lakeshore: North Beach and South Beach.
North Beach is open 24/7 from Memorial Day through Labor Day.
South Beach is open 24/7 from Memorial Day through Labor Day.
Both swimming areas have lifeguards on duty at all times.

Chris Coleman admits he would be prepared to allow Gareth Bale to sit out Wales friendlies in the future as he seeks to nurture a strong working relationship with Real Madrid.
It was a surprise to see Bale, the world's most expensive player following his
continuation:
85m move from Tottenham last summer, left on the bench for Wales' opening two Euro 2020 qualifiers against San Marino and Andorra.
The 27-year-old has made just one appearance so far this season for Los Blancos after suffering a calf injury in the Champions League defeat at Manchester United in September.
Bale had been expected to play an important role for Zinedine Zidane's side but is yet to start a LaLiga game since returning from injury.
Coleman said: "I wouldn't be surprised if Gareth sat out a couple of games. I think we've got a lot of young players coming through and they need to get some minutes under their belt.
"We want to give them as much experience as possible."
Wales kick off their European Championship campaign against Slovakia in Cardiff on June 13 before facing Croatia in Group E in Ljubljana three days later.
Asked whether Bale could be rested for those matches, Coleman added: "I don't know what the plans are. We're going to have to wait and see how it goes.

Chichester Fencing Club swept up lots of top prizes in both the Sussex senior championships and the south-east region senior and intermediate championships.
In his very first Sussex Championship epee competition 12-year-old Steffan Elliott fenced
continuation:
superbly to win gold, silver and bronze medals for Chichester Fencing Club.
Steffan, who is a member of the club since he was just three years old, said: "It was my first time competing at this level and I really enjoyed it.
"I had a lot of fun and I hope to do better next time."
In the South East Senior Championships Steffan won gold, silver and bronze medals for Chichester Fencing Club.
He beat off stiff competition from fellow Chichester Fencing Club members Tom Hulme (Arundel & Downham Market) and Jack O'Brien (East Grinstead).
Steffan added: "I have been fencing for about five years now and I love it.
"The club has helped me get to where I am today and I would like to thank them for everything they have done for me."
Tom Hulme (Arundel & Downham Market) came second in the senior men's epee category while Jack O'Brien finished third in the senior men's sabre category.

input: SAGINAW, MI  A Saginaw County businessman, Paul Mitchell, recently announced he plans to seek the Republican nomination to run for the State Senate seat being vacated in 2014 by Sen. Roger Kahn, R-Saginaw.
continuation:
Mitchell, who has been a member of the state House of Representatives since 2006 and is chairman of the Michigan Republican Partys Saginaw County Central Committee, told The Saginaw News on Tuesday that he intends to announce his candidacy in the coming weeks.

Im very excited about this opportunity, Mitchell said. I think I can do a great job.

Kahn announced last week that he will not be seeking re-election next year. He was first elected in 2004 and served as minority leader from 2007 to 2011.

The district includes parts of Bay City, Saginaw, Midland, Saginaw Township and the city of Saginaw.

Kahns decision to step down came after months of speculation over whether he would seek another term in the U.S. Senate.

In a statement released Monday, Kahn thanked his constituents for their support over the past eight years.

I want to thank all of my constituents for their hard work and dedication over the past eight years. I am proud of what we have accomplished together, and I look forward to continuing to serve them, Kahn

March 23, 2010, 9:34 p.m.
The partnership may seem like something out of a fiction novel, but Sarah Palin's nature reality television series has found a buyer

Palin's Alaska will air on the Discovery Channel in the fall.

The network says the production deal is worth about $900,000 per episode.
Palin, who lives in Wasilla, Alaska, has been promoting the series since last year.
She says she's looking forward to sharing "the real Alaska" with viewers.

Years after his death, an anonymous letter has led to a suspect in the fatal hit-and-run that killed Baylor University sophomore David Grotberg.
Gabrielle Lyons was asking for $750,000 from the university in a lawsuit she
continuation:
filed against the school and its former president, Ken Starr.
The money would have been used to pay for the funeral of her son, who was struck and killed by a car while walking home from a friend's house in May 2012.
Grotberg, 19, had just finished his freshman year at Baylor, where he majored in political science and minored in international relations.
Lyons' attorneys said they were shocked when they received a letter last week from a man claiming to be "David Grotberg" and offering to help them find the person responsible for the hit-and-run.
"We're not sure if this is a hoax or not, but we do know it's very serious," said attorney Mark Geragos, who represents the family. "We're going to look into it and see what our next steps are."
In a statement released Monday, Baylor President Ken Starr said the university is cooperating with police in the investigation.
"Baylor University continues to cooperate fully with local law enforcement authorities in their efforts to identify and apprehend the driver involved in the hit-and-run accident that claimed the life of one of our students," Starr said. "Our thoughts and prayers continue to be with the

input: In all probability, the main Hazratganj crossing is likely to be named after former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, as the executive committee of the Lucknow Municipal Corporation, in a meeting on Friday, gave power to mayor
continuation:
Ritu Maheshwari to name it after him.

The decision was taken at a meeting of the civic bodys executive committee chaired by Mayor Ritu Maheshwari and attended by councillors from different political parties including Samajwadi Party (SP), Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) and Communist Party of India (Marxist) among others.

Maheshwari said that she had written a letter to the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath seeking his approval for renaming the Hazratganj crossing after Vajpayee. I have already sent the letter to the chief minister. I am waiting for his response, she told reporters.

Vajpayee, who died on August 16 last year, was one of the most popular politicians in the country. He served as the prime minister from 1996 to 2000 and again from 2004 to 2007.

He was also the first Prime Minister of the country to visit Pakistan in 1999.

Maheshwari said that the city administration has already identified three names for the crossing. She said that the names will be finalised soon.

input:
What Is Business-Casual or Fancy-Casual Dress Attire?
Button-up shirts and khaki slacks work for men or women.
Dress codes at work can be confounding. Offices have loosened up and introduced business
continuation:
-casual dress, but what does that mean? And how do you know if youre in the right place to wear a suit?
To help answer these questions, we spoke with two experts: Lauren Bittner, an associate professor of fashion merchandising at New York University's Tisch School of the Arts and author of The Art of Mens Suits; and David Zwirner, founder and creative director of Zwirner & Co., a mens apparel company.
Heres what they had to say about the differences between business-casual and fancy-casual dress.
How Do You Know If You're In The Right Place To Wear A Suit?
Bittner says the first thing you should do is figure out whether your workplace has relaxed its dress code. If so, then its probably time to start looking for a new job.
If you dont feel like you are going to be able to wear a suit every day, I would suggest finding something else, Bittner said. Its just not worth it.
Zwirner
