SALT LAKE CITY  Evan McMullin sat at a conference table in his modest campaign headquarters here one morning last week, struggling to pick which high-profile Republican had most disappointed him this year.
"Can we just say 'all of
continuation:
them'?" he asked rhetorically. "I mean, it's not that I don't like Mitt Romney or Rick Santorum or Newt Gingrich or Ron Paul, but none of them have done what they said they were going to do."
McMullin, the former Utah governor who ran for president as an independent in 2012 and lost to President Barack Obama, has spent much of the last two years trying to make amends with voters who cast ballots against him four years ago.
He is running for the U.S. Senate seat being vacated by Orrin Hatch, R-Utah, in November. The race will be closely watched because it could help determine whether Republicans can hold on to their majority in the U.S. Senate.
In a recent interview, McMullin talked about why he decided to jump into the race and how he plans to differentiate himself from other candidates.
Q: What made you decide to run again?
A: It's been a long time since I've been in public office, and I'm tired of waiting around for things to happen. I'm tired of waiting for people to come to me. I'm tired of waiting for my voice to be heard. I want to be able to

Hang headboards on sturdy cleats.
Measure the distance from the floor up the wall to the desired terminating point at the top of the headboard. Subtract 6 inches and make a mark. Use a level to draw an 18-
continuation:
1/2-inch-wide line along the bottom edge of the headboard, marking it with a pencil so you can measure it later. Measure the distance from the bottom edge of the headboard to the end of the bed frame. Divide that measurement by 2.5 to get your headboard's height.
If you're using a headboard with a removable footboard, mark where you want the footboard to go in relation to the headboard. If you're using a headboard with no removable footboard, mark where you want the footboard to be in relation to the headboard. If you don't have enough room for the footboard, add an inch or two to the length of the headboard to accommodate the footboard. If you do have enough room for the footboard, add an inch or two to the length of the headboard to accommodate the footboard.
When choosing a headboard, consider how much space is left between the mattress and the headboard. You'll want to choose a headboard that will give you plenty of room to move around without having to bend over to reach things.

Only one country featuring Avalanche representatives was in action Saturday at the 2010 IIHF Mens World Championship in Germany.
Playing in the Relegation Round after gaining just two points in the Preliminary Round, T.J. Galiardi
continuation:
scored a goal and added an assist to lead Canada to a 4-2 win over Russia in Cologne, Germany.
Canada will face the Czech Republic on Sunday at 3:30 p.m. (CST) in the quarter-finals of Group B. The Czech Republic defeated Sweden 2-1 earlier in the day.
The winner of that game will advance to the Semifinals where they will play either the United States or Finland on Monday at 5:30 p.m. (CST).
In the other Group B match, Slovakia defeated the United States 2-0.
Galiardi opened the scoring with a power-play goal midway through the first period, then added an empty-netter with less than a minute remaining to give Canada a 1-0 lead heading into the first intermission.
Travis Hamonic also scored for the Canadians, who outshot the Russians 14-6 in the opening frame.
Russia got on the board early in the second period when Vladimir Tarasenko scored his team-leading 12th goal of the tournament.
But Canada responded with three goals in a span of four minutes late in the second period to take control of the game.

The Utes return five of their top seven scorers in 2019-20, and will have two redshirts available.
(Rick Egan | The Salt Lake Tribune) USC Trojans forward Bennie Boatwright (25) trails Utah U
continuation:
tes guard Tyger Campbell (1) during the first half of an NCAA college basketball game on Thursday, Nov. 21, 2019, at Vivint Smart Home Arena in Salt Lake City.
SALT LAKE CITY  It's a new season for the Utah men's basketball team, and it's going to be a different look as well.
After losing four starters from last year's team that went 20-13 overall and 13-7 in Pac-12 play, the Utes are bringing back five players who played significant roles in 2018-19.
"We've got a lot of guys returning," said coach Larry Krystkowiak. "I'm excited about that. I think we're going to be better than we were last year."
Here is a closer look at the Utes' roster heading into the 2020-21 campaign:
Tyger Campbell
Campbell, a 6-foot-3 junior, led the Utes with 12.6 points per game last season. He also averaged 3.4 rebounds and 1.9 assists per contest.
He was named to the All-Pac-12 Second Team after leading the conference in scoring and rebounding while shooting 50 percent from the field.

input: Twenty-five years ago, at Minneapolis Southern Theater, Gale LaJoye created Snowflake, a one-man show featuring a sad-sack clown who turned a junk-strewn vacant lot into a place of
continuation:
magic and wonder.

LaJoye has since gone on to create more than 20 other shows, including The Wizard of Oz, A Midsummer Nights Dream and The Nutcracker, among others. He also wrote the book for the Broadway musical Hairspray, which opened last week in New York City.

But this weekend, hell be back in his hometown with a new show called Gale: The Great American Clown. It runs Friday through Sunday at the Minnesota State Fairgrounds Expo Hall.

Im very excited about it, because Ive never been able to do something like this before, he said by phone from his home in Los Angeles. Ive always been able to go out and do my own thing, but this is the first time that Ive ever been able to work with an entire cast and have them all come together under one roof. Its going to be great.

input:
There's something important that chronically indecisive people need to understand: They're not actually interested in making a decision. Since this statement flies brazenly in the face of common sense, let me restate it differently.
Indeed, as these individuals anguish
continuation:
over what they should do with their lives, they can't seem to make up their minds about anything at all. It's as if they've been waiting for someone to tell them what to do, and now that person is nowhere to be found.
This phenomenon is called indecision, and it's a serious problem for those of us who are constantly trying to figure out what we want to do with our lives. For example, I'm currently working on my master's degree, but I have no idea what I'm going to study or where I'm going to get a job when I graduate. In fact, I don't even know if I want to go to graduate school.
In other words, indecisiveness is a major roadblock to achieving your life goals. And while you may not realize it, there's a good chance that you suffer from some form of indecisiveness.
Here are three reasons why indecisiveness is such a big problem.
1. You Don't Know What You Want To Do With The Rest Of Your Life.
Decision-making is one of the most important skills you'll ever learn. When you're faced with an overwhelming amount of options, you need to be able to quickly

input: Marvel and Freeform (formerly ABC Family) have released a trailer for Cloak & Dagger, their new superhero series aimed at the young adult crowd. But what secrets lie within? Watch the latest Cloak and Dagger trailer below, and join us for a very
continuation:
special episode of Marvels Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. tonight on ABC at 10/9c.

Cloak & Dagger premieres Tuesday, March 5 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on Freeform. The series is executive produced by Jeph Loeb (The Amazing Spider-Man 2), who also serves as showrunner, along with Jessica Queller (The Vampire Diaries, Once Upon a Time in Wonderland).

Check out our exclusive sneak peek of the first two episodes below:

Heres the official synopsis for Cloak & Dagger:

Set in present-day New York City, Cloak & Dagger is an action-adventure series that takes place in a world where superheroes are just another day at the office. In order to protect the city from threats greater than anything it has ever seen, a group of super-powered citizens band together to form a secret organization known as the Dagger Society. However, things get complicated when one of the Dagger Society members turns out to be the daughter of the most powerful man in the country. Now, she must choose between her duty to her family and her newfound powers.

CALGARY, Alberta (Reuters) - Encana Corp (ECA.TO), Canadas largest natural gas producer, slashed its 2015 capital budget by a quarter on Wednesday in response to a slump in global crude oil prices.
The
continuation:
Calgary-based company said it now expects to spend C$4.2 billion ($3.6 billion) this year, down from a previous forecast of C$5.0 billion.
Encana shares were down 3.1 percent at C$9.50 in early trading on the Toronto Stock Exchange.
The company also cut its production guidance for the year, saying it now expects to produce between 590 million and 600 million cubic feet equivalent per day (mcf/d), down from a previous range of 610 mcf/d to 650 mcf/d.
We are lowering our 2015 production guidance due to lower than expected commodity prices, Chief Executive Doug Suttles said on a conference call with analysts.
Encana is the latest Canadian energy company to reduce its capital spending plans as oil prices have tumbled over the past few months.
Royal Dutch Shell Plc (RDSa.L) and Suncor Energy Inc (SU.TO) both trimmed their capital budgets earlier this month, while Canadian Natural Resources Ltd (CNQ.TO) has said it will slash spending by up to 25 percent.
Encanas cash flow was hit hard by the plunge in oil prices

A new ad by WestJet airlines features
continuation:
a man who has been stranded in Mexico for more than two months, and hes not happy about it.
Im just trying to get home, he says in the video, which was posted on social media earlier this week. Ive been stuck here for almost two months now.
The video shows him being driven around in a limousine, accompanied by a woman dressed as Santa Claus.
Were going to make sure that you have everything you need to get through this holiday season, she says at one point.
WestJet said in a news release that the video is meant to be a light-hearted way to help its customers during the COVID-19 pandemic.
We know that many of our guests are looking forward to seeing their loved ones over the holidays and we want to ensure they can do so safely, said WestJet president and CEO Ed Sims in a statement.
Thats why we wanted to create something that would brighten someones day and give them a little bit of hope during these difficult times.

While the Senate debated a lengthy series of amendments to the proposed malpractice reform bill, the Assembly plowed ahead and pushed the plan through committee and to a vote on the floor Tuesday night.
As the Assembly convened at 9:30 p.m
continuation:
., it was clear that there would be no more debate on the bill, which had passed the Judiciary Committee earlier in the day.
Assembly Speaker Carl Heastie (D-Bronx/Queens) announced that the bill would be sent to the full Assembly for consideration.
"We're going to pass this bill," he said. "I'm confident we will."
Heastie added that the bill's passage would send a strong message to the medical community about the need to change its culture when it comes to treating patients.
"This is an important moment in our state's history," Heastie said. "We are moving forward with legislation that will make New York a better place to live, work and raise a family."
The bill, sponsored by Sen. Liz Krueger (D-Manhattan) and Rep. Nicole Malliotakis (R-Staten Island/Brooklyn), aims to improve access to quality health care for New Yorkers.
It includes several key provisions, including requiring doctors and other health care providers to report serious injuries or deaths to the state Department of Health within 24 hours. It also establishes a $50 million annual fund to help pay for nursing home and assisted living facility residents who

input:
(JTA)  Five of the fatalities in the terrorist truck-ramming attack in New York City on Tuesday afternoon were Argentine tourists celebrating the 30th anniversary of their high school graduation, including one Jewish businessman.
According to Argentinas
continuation:
Foreign Minister Jorge Faurie, the victims included three women and two men from Buenos Aires, as well as a man from Uruguay. Two other people were hospitalized with serious injuries but are expected to survive.
The attacker, Sayfullo Habibullaevic Saipov, was killed by police after he crashed his rented truck into a bike path near Times Square around 2:30 p.m. local time (5:30 p.m. EST). He had been shot by an off-duty NYPD officer who happened to be passing by the scene.
Faurie told reporters that all five victims were Argentinian citizens, and that they were celebrating the 30th anniversary of their high school graduation. He did not identify them or give any further details.
"It is a sad day for our country," President Mauricio Macri said in a statement. "We express our deepest condolences to the families and friends of the victims, and we wish a speedy recovery to those who have been injured."
Macri added that he would travel to New York later this week to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump.
New York Mayor Bill de Blasio also released a statement saying that he was devastated

A guard outside convicted fraudster Schabir Shaik's Morningside house in Durban.
Schabir Shaik is not being hauled back to jail.
Instead the convicted fraudster is "very busy" at his Morningside
continuation:
home, where he lives with his wife and three children.
Shaik was jailed for five years last year for defrauding more than R1-million from a number of people.
He was also ordered to pay a fine of R200 000.
But this week it was revealed that he had been released on parole after serving just over half of his sentence.
The Correctional Services Department told News24 that Shaik was granted parole on Wednesday.

It said the decision to grant him parole was made following an assessment by the Parole Board of South Africa (PBSA) and the National Prosecuting Authority (NPA).
In a statement, the department said: "The parole board assessed Mr Shaik's risk of reoffending as low. He has already served one-third of his custodial sentence.
"Mr Shaik will be under supervision for the next six months, during which time he will have to abide by strict conditions."
News24 previously reported that Shaik had been granted parole in December 2018.

input:
WhileComcast had its problems in 2015, its Universal Pictures segment had an unprecedented year specifically with franchise films.
It's not that other segments of the business struggled. Cable was strong, despite cord-cutting fears, and even
continuation:
Disney's ESPN+ streaming service had a successful launch.
The problem for Comcast, which owns NBCUniversal, is that it doesn't have as much control over what goes into those franchises as it once did.
In the first nine months of this year, the company earned $2.6 billion from its theme parks division, up from $1.8 billion in the same period last year. That's largely due to higher attendance at Universal Studios Japan and Islands of Adventure in Orlando, Florida.
Cable revenue rose 4% to $19.4 billion, while operating income jumped 18% to $3.7 billion. Operating margins were flat at 12.5%.
Comcast shares were down about 1% in after-hours trading. The stock has risen more than 30% since the beginning of the year.
Here are some highlights from the earnings report:
Revenue rose 4% to $19.4 billion.
Operating income jumped 18% to $3.7 billion.
Operating margins were flat at 12.5%.
Earnings per share came in at $1.50, ahead of the average analyst estimate of $1.45

In the run-up to The Independent Show next week, Adara Technologies has announced that it will partner with CCI Systems on its cloud-based, managed advanced video solutions for mid-to-small sized service providers.
CCI Systems of
continuation:
Santa Clara, Calif., is a leading provider of software and services to the communications and media industries. Its products are used by companies such as AT&T, DirecTV, Comcast, Cox Communications, Time Warner Cable, Verizon FiOS, and many others.
Were excited about this partnership because it gives us an opportunity to provide our customers with more value than ever before, said David Hensley, chief technology officer at Adara Technologies, in a press release. By combining Adaras high-performance video processing platform with CCIs award-winning customer support, we can offer our customers the best of both worlds.
Adaras Video Processing Platform (VPP) provides real-time transcoding, compression, and delivery of high-quality video content over IP networks. The VPP is designed to be flexible enough to adapt to changing business needs. It also supports a wide range of file formats, including AVI, MP4, MOV, WMV, ASF, MPEG-4 AVC/H.264, H.265, HEVC, 3GPP2, and MPEG-4 AVC/H.264.

input: New versions of two popular golf ball families hitting the market last week was not relatively big news. What did capture plenty of attention was that both are updated high-optic renditions -- each with their own spin. Mind you, non-white golf
continuation:
balls have been around for quite some time, but this is the first time theyve been offered in a new colorway.

The Nike Golf Pro V1 Black/White and Nike Golf Pro V1 White/Black will be available at retailers nationwide beginning on May 1. The Nike Golf Pro V1 Black/White is priced at $109.99 while the Nike Golf Pro V1 White/Black will retail for $119.99. Both models will also be available online at www.nike.com/golf.

Nike Golfs ProV1 family of golf balls has seen its fair share of updates over the past couple of years. In 2010, Nike Golf introduced the Nike Golf Pro V1 White/Black and the Nike Golf Pro V1 White/Black XL. In 2011, Nike Golf introduced the Nike Golf Pro V1 White/Black XL and the Nike Golf Pro V1 White/Black XL. And in 2012, Nike Golf introduced the Nike Golf Pro V1 Black/White and Nike Golf Pro V1 Black/White XL.

input: This basic galette recipe can be tailored to fit whatever fruit you have on hand. The key is to scale the amount of sugar and cornstarch. Generally speaking, tart stone fruits (apricots, peaches, nectarines, pl
continuation:
ums) are sweeter than sweet cherries or apricots.

If you dont want to make your own sourdough starter, you can use store-bought yeast. Just make sure that it doesnt contain maltodextrin, which is used as a preservative in some commercial yeasts.

Ingredients:

1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour

1 teaspoon baking powder

1/4 teaspoon salt

1/4 cup granulated sugar

1/2 cup cornstarch

3 tablespoons water

Directions:

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease an 8-inch springform pan with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.

In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar until well combined. In a small bowl, combine the cornstarch and water; stir into the dry ingredients until just combined.

Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for about 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool completely before removing from the pan.

Serve warm or at room temperature.

Notes

ST GEORGES, Grenada,
continuation:
Wednesday, July 26, 2017  The Grenada Community Foundation (GCF) has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Caribbean Disaster Emergency Management Agency (CDEMA) to enhance collaboration in disaster risk reduction and preparedness.
The MoU was signed by Monica La Bennett, vice-president (operations) and Javier Manzanares, executive director ad interim.
The signing ceremony was held at the Grenada Cultural Centre in St George's on Wednesday morning.
"This is an opportunity for us to work together to ensure that our communities are prepared for disasters," said La Bennett. "We will be working closely with CDEMA to ensure that we are able to reduce the number of deaths and injuries as a result of natural disasters."
Manzanares added: "I am very excited about this partnership because it will enable us to collaborate more effectively in disaster preparedness and response. This will also help us to better understand each others challenges so that we can come up with innovative ways to deal with them."
He noted that the agreement would allow the two organisations to share best practices and learn from each other in order to improve disaster preparedness and response in Grenada.

input: ST. LOUIS, MO (KTVI) - The City of St. Louis confirms three additional heat deaths, bringin the total of deaths in the city to 17. The St. Louis City Health Director is now asking the Centers for
continuation:
Disease Control and Prevention to conduct an investigation into the city's high number of heat-related deaths this year.
The health department said it is working with the CDC to determine if there are any common factors that could be contributing to these deaths.
In a press release, the health department said it has received more than 200 calls about heat-related illnesses since July 1st. Of those, more than half have been children under the age of 18.
Health officials say the best way to protect yourself from the heat is to stay indoors as much as possible. If you must go outside, make sure to drink plenty of water and wear light-colored, loose-fitting clothing.

input: PANAMA CITY BEACH, Fla. (WJHG/WECP) - Rugby originated in England in the 19th century. For those in America who may still be unfamiliar with the sports, imagine the option offense without pads.
continuation:
It's called rugby sevens, and it's a fast-paced game that combines elements of American football, rugby union, and rugby league.
The sport is played by teams of six players on either side. Each team has one goal: to score as many points as they can within the allotted time.
"It's very exciting," said Panama City Beach High School rugby player, Jaxon Hensley. "I think it's a great way to get kids involved in physical activity, and I think it's a great way to teach them about teamwork and how to work together."
Rugby sevens has been around for decades, but it's only in the last decade or so that its popularity has skyrocketed. In fact, there are now more than 100 countries represented in the World Rugby Sevens Series.
"We've got some really good athletes here at home, and we've got some really good athletes from other parts of the world," said Panama City Beach High School head rugby coach, Matt O'Connor. "So, we're excited to see where this takes us."

input: Alan Alda has had a magical career, earning seven Emmys and a raft of other awards, including six Golden Globes, plus an Oscar nomination for his role as a Republican Senator in 2004's "The Aviator." He has also written and
continuation:
starred in dozens of films.

But he is best known for playing the title character in the classic 1960s TV series "M*A*S*H," which ran on ABC from 1969 to 1973. It was one of the most popular shows on television at the time, with more than 100 million viewers tuning in each week.

"It's hard to believe that it's been 50 years since M*A*S*H ended," Alda told NPR's Audie Cornish in a recent interview. "I remember watching it when I was a kid, and I still think about it every now and then."

Alda, who turns 83 next month, says he still watches the show occasionally.

"I'm not sure if I'll ever be able to watch it again without getting teary-eyed," he said. "I don't know how many times I've watched it over the years."

In fact, Alda has become so attached to the role that he even named his firstborn son after it.

"I have three children, and they all have the same middle name: 'M*A*S*H,'" he said. "My wife doesn't like

Catch 22 owner Mark Clyburn spoke to the Greenfield Village Council on Wednesday about holding a music festival at Mitchell Park.
A local business owner whos hoping to put on a music festival as his business approaches an anniversary asked permission from
continuation:
the village council to do so.
Mark Clyburn, owner of The Catch 22, which is celebrating its 20th anniversary this year, has applied for a special use permit to hold a three-day music festival at Mitchell Park.
The event would take place between July 27 and 29 and would be open to the public.
Clyburn said that he had been approached by a number of people who were interested in hosting their own events at the park.
Were just trying to see if we can work something out, he said. I think its going to be a lot of fun. Ive never done anything like this before, but Im sure itll be a lot of fun.
Clyburn said that he was not looking to charge anyone for admission to the festival.
I dont want anybody to have to pay to get in, he said. Its all free.
He added that he hoped the event would help bring more people to the area.
Its a really nice place to come and hang out,

input:
REDLANDS  Thanks to local Twilight fans, Redlands Community Hospital more than doubled the amount of blood collected at their monthly drive Tuesday.
The hospital hosted the first of two Twilight-themed blood
continuation:
drives in conjunction with the movies third and final installment, New Moon, which will be released on Nov. 22.
The drive was held from 5:30 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. at the hospitals parking lot, located at 1201 S. Main St.
Donors received a special Twilight T-shirt as a thank you for donating blood.
This is our first time doing something like this and we are really happy with how it turned out, said Dr. Michael J. Gorman, chief medical officer. We had a good turnout and we were able to collect over 100 units of red blood cells and platelets.
Gorman added that the hospital has seen an increase in the number of patients who have been diagnosed with leukemia and lymphoma in recent months.
We want to make sure that these patients get the best care possible, he said. We also wanted to do something to help raise awareness about the need for blood donations.

input: "Cape Cod-meets-Santa Monica is one of the ways chef-owner Marc Taft of Mariettas Chicken and the Egg explains Brine Seafood Shack, his new chic but laid-back restaurant at
continuation:
the end of Main Street in downtown Kennesaw.

We want people to feel like theyre in Santa Monica or Cape Cod," he said. "Its a place where you can come and relax and enjoy a great meal with good company."

Brine, which opened last week, features an eclectic menu that includes oysters, clams, shrimp, scallops, mussels, lobster, fish tacos, pasta dishes, salads, soups, sandwiches and desserts. It also has a wine list with more than 100 wines from around the world.

Taft, who grew up on Long Island, moved to Atlanta about 10 years ago and worked for several restaurants there before moving back to Georgia.

"I was looking for a way to get back into my home state, and I found it here," Taft said.

His first job out of college was as a sous-chef at a New York City restaurant. He went on to work for some of the top chefs in the country, including Michael Mina, Thomas Keller and Daniel Boulud, among others.

The extent of GOP efforts to prevent black people and Latinos from voting is jaw-dropping. And this Nov. 8, minority voters need to document it so America can see.
Donald Trumps offensive statements and the chaos theyve
continuation:
created in his administration have made it clear that he doesnt give a damn about black and brown people.
Trumps racist rhetoric has emboldened white supremacists across the country, including neo-Nazis and Ku Klux Klansmen who are planning to descend on Charlottesville, Va., for the Unite the Right rally on Aug. 12.
In the wake of the massacre at a gay nightclub in Orlando that left 49 people dead, President Obama issued a statement urging Americans to come together as one nation, under God, indivisible, with liberty and justice for all  no matter where you come from, what you look like, or who you love.
Its not enough to say those words; we must act upon them.
On Tuesday, Ill be participating in the National Voter Registration Day, an event organized by the League of Women Voters that aims to increase voter registration among African-Americans, Hispanics and other communities of color.
Voter registration is a critical step toward making our democracy more representative of the American people. Its also a powerful tool for fighting back against racism and xenophobia.

THERE were loud cheers, and a few tears as Hayley Talbot paddled her corflute kayak into Whiting Beach this morning.
With the song "Happy" playing, she raised her paddle in the air as she reached the
continuation:
end of her journey to raise money for Cancer Council Queensland.
Hayley said it was a great way to start the day.
"It's really good to see everyone out here supporting me," she said.
"I'm just so happy to be able to do something positive with my time."
She is one of more than 100 people who have signed up to paddle across the Great Barrier Reef from Townsville to Cairns.
The event is being held in partnership with the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority (GBRMPA) and supported by Tourism and Events Queensland.
Cancer Council Queensland chief executive officer Dr Kerryn Phelps said the organisation was proud to support the Great Barrier Reef Kayak Challenge.
"We know that the Great Barrier Reef has an incredible effect on the health of our oceans, and we're thrilled to be part of this fundraising initiative," she said.
"This challenge will provide much-needed funds to help us continue to work towards a world free of cancer."
Ms Phelps said the Great Barrier Reef Kayak Challenge was a fantastic opportunity to raise awareness about the importance of marine conservation.
"The Great Barrier Reef is one of the most biodiverse places on Earth, and we need to protect

input:
House Democrats on Friday unveiled a comprehensive elections and ethics reform package that targets what they call a "culture of corruption in Washington" and aims to reduce the role of money in politics.
Maryland Rep. Elijah Cummings, the new chairman of the House
continuation:
Oversight and Government Reform Committee, said his committee will hold a hearing next week to examine whether President Donald Trump's campaign coordinated with Russia during the 2016 presidential election.
Cummings' committee is also investigating allegations of Russian interference in the U.S. political system, as well as possible ties between Trump associates and Russia.
The bill would create an independent commission to investigate foreign influence in the 2016 election. It would also require candidates for federal office to disclose their financial interests, including any loans or gifts from foreign nationals.
The bill would also prohibit lobbyists from giving more than $5,000 to a candidate or political action committee in a single calendar year.
It would also make it easier for Americans to vote by mail, expand early voting and establish automatic voter registration, among other provisions.
"We are going to be looking at this very closely," Cummings told reporters after unveiling the legislation. "I don't know if we're going to be able to get everything done, but I think there's a lot of good things here."
Cummings said he wants to work with Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer, D-N.Y., to reach a bipartisan agreement.

input:
It took just 80 years for the Roman Empire to fall apart as a political unit.
When Theodosius the Great died in 395, he bequeathed to his two feckless sonsHonorius, a 10-year-
continuation:
old boy, and Marcus Aurelius, who was 12 at the timethe responsibility of ruling over an empire that had stretched from Asia Minor to the Black Sea, encompassing more than one-third of the worlds population. It would have been enough to make any young ruler nervous, but it was especially daunting for these two boys, who had grown up under the tutelage of their father, a military genius who had risen through the ranks to become the first emperor since Julius Caesar to command legions in both Europe and Africa.
Theodosius, however, was no ordinary emperor. He was the son of a wealthy aristocrat and the younger brother of another powerful nobleman. In addition to being a brilliant general, he was also a gifted orator, a man who could speak eloquently on any subject, even if it didnt directly relate to politics. As a result, he became known as The Emperors Orator, a title bestowed upon him by the Senate when he was only 19 years old.
But Theodosius wasnt content with merely serving as a statesman. He wanted to expand the empire beyond its borders, into what is now

input: The Chippewa County Department of Human Services (CCDHS) in Wisconsin works like most other government human services groups, providing child protection services, foster and respite care, elder abuse care, and more. However, they recently launched an
continuation:
initiative called Caring Connections to help people who are struggling with mental health or substance abuse issues find the resources they need.

They have a website where you can find information about their services, as well as how to apply for assistance. The site also includes a form that you can fill out if youre having trouble getting the help you need.

You can also call 1-800-273-8255 or text 838255 to reach the Crisis Text Line, which is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

Heres the link: https://www.wisconsin.gov/dhs/dhs-services/caring-connections/

If you think someone you know may be suffering from mental illness or addiction, you can contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). You can also text HOME to 741-741 to connect with a trained crisis responder.

Also, check out this article on Mental Health Awareness Month.

input:
The US president, George Bush, today called on Israel to end its 41-year occupation of Palestinian land and predicted a peace treaty would be signed by the time he leaves office.
Speaking after a meeting with the Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas, Bush
continuation:
said: "I think it's very likely that we will have a peace agreement between the Israelis and the Palestinians before I leave office."
He added: "It's not going to happen overnight. It's going to take a lot of hard work and a lot of patience, but I think it is possible."
Bush, who was in the West Bank city of Ramallah for the first time since taking office in January 2001, made the comments during a joint press conference with Abbas.
Abbas, whose government has been based in the West Bank city of Ramallah since his election in 2005, has repeatedly refused to sign a peace treaty with the Jewish state unless it recognises Palestine as an independent state with East Jerusalem as its capital.
"We are here to talk about peace," Bush said. "We are here to talk about security. We are here to talk about economic development. We are here to talk about human rights. We are here to talk about the future of the Palestinian people."
In response to a question from a reporter, Bush said he did not believe the Israeli-Palestinian conflict had become more intractable than at any other time in recent history.
"I don't think there's ever been a more

input:
A judge ruled on Monday that the state of Massachusetts cannot sue the federal government for expanding a religious exemption to the Affordable Care Act's contraceptive mandate.
"While we are disappointed in this decision, we remain steadfast in our commitment to ensuring affordable and reliable
continuation:
health care for all Americans," Massachusetts Attorney General Maura Healey (D) said in a statement after the ruling. "We will continue to work with the Trump Administration to ensure that women have access to safe, effective birth control."
The case was brought by the Becket Fund for Religious Liberty, a nonprofit legal organization that represents more than two dozen Roman Catholic dioceses across the country, including Boston, which had asked the court to strike down the contraception mandate as an unconstitutional violation of their religious freedom.
The Obama administration issued a rule in 2015 that required employers who provide insurance plans to employees to cover contraceptives at no additional cost. The rule also included a religious exemption that would allow employers to opt out of covering contraceptives if doing so violated their sincerely held religious beliefs.
In 2016, President Donald Trump signed an executive order exempting religious organizations from having to comply with Obamacare's contraceptive coverage requirements. In 2017, the Department of Health and Human Services published a final rule that expanded the religious exemption to include any employer who objects to providing contraception coverage based on religious or moral objections.

ACCOMACK COUNTY, Va. -- Two classic American novels have been temporarily banned from a Virginia school district after a parent raised concerns about the use of a racial slur.
The use of the books The Adventures of Huckle
continuation:
berry Finn and To Kill a Mockingbird, both written by Harper Lee in the 1960s, has sparked outrage among some parents and educators who say it is inappropriate for students to be exposed to such material.
In a letter obtained by CBS affiliate WAVY-TV (http://cbsloc.al/2l9qh0j ) dated May 31, Superintendent Dr. John R. Wilson wrote that the books will not be used at any public schools in the county until further notice.
I am writing to inform you that the Board of Education has decided to temporarily ban the use of The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn, To Kill a Mockingbird, and To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee from being read aloud or discussed in any classroom setting within the ACMSD, effective immediately. This decision was made based on the fact that these books contain explicit references to racial slurs, which are offensive to many members of our community, including African Americans, Hispanics, Native Americans, Asian Americans, Pacific Islanders, and other minority groups, Wilson wrote.

input:
A woman wears Google Glass at an unrelated book presentation and media event on June 10, 2014 in Berlin, Germany.
If there's anything the Ellen Pao trial showed, it's that sexism is still alive in Silicon Valley. But some tech companies
continuation:
are taking steps to make their workplaces more gender-equal.
Google, for example, recently announced a new policy that requires all of its employees to sign a pledge saying they will not discriminate against anyone based on sexual orientation or gender identity.
The company also says it will no longer hire people who have been convicted of crimes involving drugs or alcohol.
"We want our workplace to be a place where everyone feels safe and respected," said Google spokeswoman Liz Bourgeois. "We're committed to doing everything we can to make sure that happens."
Pao was fired from her job as chief executive officer of venture capital firm Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers after she filed a lawsuit accusing the company of gender discrimination. She lost the case last year, but has continued to work as a venture capitalist.
In a recent interview with The New York Times, Pao talked about how the trial had changed her life.
"I feel like I've been given a second chance," she told the newspaper. "I'm going to use this opportunity to change the world."

A British Columbia engineering science professor has developed a high-resolution scanner that he says will revolutionize how eye diseases are diagnosed to prevent vision loss.
Prof. Marinko Sarunic of Simon Fraser University said doctors currently use low-resolution scanners that
continuation:
cant tell the difference between healthy and diabetic retinopathy, which is the leading cause of blindness in older adults.
Sarunics new device uses a laser beam to measure blood flow through the retina.
He said the technology could be used to detect early signs of diabetic retinopathy, such as dark circles under the eyes or blurred vision.
The research was funded by the Canadian Institutes of Health Research.

input: Roxie Zwicker and her friends jokingly call themselves good witches from the North. The joke isnt about the fact that they are, indeed, witches with good intentions. They are. The joke is about
continuation:
how much of a pain in the ass it can be for them to get out of bed in the morning.

Zwicker was born with cerebral palsy, which means she has no control over her legs or arms. She uses a wheelchair and relies on a walker to get around. Her condition makes it difficult for her to do things like brush her teeth or go to the bathroom by herself.

But Zwicker doesnt let her disability hold her back. Shes determined to become an advocate for people with disabilities. And shes not alone.

I think theres a lot of people who feel like they dont have a voice, Zwicker said. And I think theres a lot of people who feel like they dont have a voice because they dont know what to say.

Thats why she and her friends decided to form a group called Good Witches From the North. Their mission? To help others find their own voices.

Its really important for me to be able to share my experiences with other people,

input: SPRINGFIELD -- The Department of Children and Family Services began issuing layoff notices to 600 employees on Friday with the aim of paring its workforce by 375 positions while still meeting its legal obligations to care for abused and neglected children and provide other services
continuation:
, officials said.

The layoffs are part of DCFSs plan to reduce costs by $15 million over the next two years as it faces a projected budget deficit of more than $50 million in fiscal year 2016-17, which begins Oct. 1.

Were going to do everything we can to make sure that these kids are taken care of, DCFS Secretary MaryEllen Elia said during a news conference at the agencys headquarters in Springfield. This is not an easy decision, but its the right one.

DCFS employs about 3,000 people, including caseworkers, investigators, social workers and others who work directly with abused or neglected children. The department also contracts with private agencies to perform some of its duties, such as taking custody of children from parents who have been convicted of child abuse or neglect.

In addition to laying off staff, DCFS plans to close three of its five regional office locations in Springfield, Chicopee and Northampton. It also will consolidate its service areas into three regions: Western, Central and Northeast.

Its going to be very difficult,

The latest breaking news in entertainment, pop culture, crime, politics and lifestyle.
Authorities say 21-year-old Jordan Witmer shot and killed two men and wounded a woman before killing himself.
A gunman opened fire at a hotel bar near
continuation:
Chicago's O'Hare International Airport on Friday night, killing one person and wounding three others, authorities said.
The shooting occurred just before 11:30 p.m., according to the Cook County medical examiner's office. The names of the victims have not yet been released.
Chicago police spokesman Anthony Guglielmi said officers responding to a call of shots fired found three people with gunshot wounds. Two were pronounced dead at the scene. A third victim was taken to Northwestern Memorial Hospital in critical condition, Guglielmi said.
Guglielmi said investigators believe there is no ongoing threat to the public. He did not release any information about a possible motive.
Witmer was being held without bond on charges of first-degree murder, attempted first-degree murder, unlawful use of a weapon and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon, according to jail records. It wasn't immediately clear if he had an attorney who could comment on his behalf.

input: Analysis - The prime minister was a media darling in New York, while at home the opposition ramped up attacks over the Meka Whaitiri affair and chased ministers along the trail of the Derek Handley emails. Peter Wilson looks at a busy week
continuation:
for Jacinda Ardern

The Prime Ministers trip to the United States this week has been billed as an opportunity to re-energise the countrys relationship with the worlds most powerful democracy, but her time there has been overshadowed by a series of high-profile controversies that have raised questions about her ability to deliver on her promises.

Jacinda Arderns first official visit to the US since she took office in September last year was billed as a chance to build on the strong bilateral relations between the two countries, particularly after Donald Trumps election victory.

However, it has become increasingly clear that the trip has not gone according to plan.

On Tuesday, Ms Ardern was forced to backtrack from comments she made during a press conference in which she said she would be open to negotiating a free trade agreement (FTA) with the European Union (EU).

input: Father of the Nation' is an honorific bestowed on individuals who are considered the most important in the process of the establishment of a country or a nation. They are instrumental in the birth of their nations by way of liberating them from colonial or other occupation
continuation:
forces.

The Father of the Nation (FON) is usually referred to as the "father" of his nation, but this title can also be used to refer to the first president of the United States, Abraham Lincoln.

Contents

History

Origins

The origins of the FON are not well-known. It is believed that it was originally bestowed upon those who had been involved in the founding of their nation, such as Alexander Hamilton, George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, and Benjamin Franklin. However, some historians have suggested that the FON could have been given to any individual, regardless of whether they were involved in the founding of their nation.

In 18th century Europe, there were many different titles for men who played an important role in the establishment of their nation. These included the King of France, the King of England, the King of Spain, the King of Portugal, the King of Denmark, the King of Norway, the King of Sweden, the King of Prussia, the Duke of Saxe-Coburg-Gotha, the Duke of Brunswick-Lneburg, the Duke of Bavaria, the Duke of Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach

input: A classic British memoir gets the full costume drama treatment with this beautifully crafted World War I drama, although it never quite transcends the "beloved book" tone, remaining so worthy that it only rarely springs to life. The acting is sharp, as
continuation:
always, and there's a lot of good stuff in here, but the story just doesn't come together for me.

The film is based on the novel of the same name by Anthony Trollope, which was first published in 1867. It tells the story of two young Englishmen who are sent to France to serve in the French Foreign Legion during the First World War. One of the men is played by Michael Gambon, best known for his role as Albus Dumbledore in the Harry Potter series, while the other is played by Tom Hiddleston, best known for his role as Loki in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Trollope wrote the screenplay for the film adaptation himself, and he also served as an executive producer on the project. He was also responsible for the production design of the film, and he also designed the costumes for the film.

There's a lot going on in this movie. There's plenty of action, plenty of drama, and plenty of romance. And yet, despite all of those things, I still don't really care much about any of it. I'm not sure if it's because I haven't read the book, or if it's because I've seen so many

input: ISLAMABAD, Oct 27 (APP): Minister for Finance Senator Muhammad Ishaq Dar Thursday said that due to prudent economic policies of the government, macro economic stability has been achieved and now focus was on the sustainable economic growth for job creation
continuation:
.
He expressed these views while chairing a meeting of National Economic Council (NEC) here at Prime Ministers Office (PMO).
The meeting was attended among others by Federal Minister for Planning, Development and Special Initiatives Asad Umar, Adviser to PM on Commerce Abdul Razak Dawood, Chief Secretary Punjab Chaudhry Nisar Ali Khan, Chief Secretary Sindh Ghulam Murtaza Baloch, Chairman Board of Investment (BoI) Zubair Ahmed Siddiqui and other senior officials.
During the course of the discussion, it was decided that the government would take all possible steps to enhance investment in the country and create employment opportunities.
It was also decided that the BoI should be made more efficient and effective so that it could play an active role in attracting foreign direct investments (FDI) in the country.
In this regard, special attention should be paid to ease of doing business as well as facilitation of FDI in the country.
The finance minister directed the BoI to work out a comprehensive plan to improve the ease of doing business in the country.
He also directed the BoI to devise a mechanism to identify bottlenecks in the FDI

input:
ANKARA (Reuters) - For all of Irans fierce verbal response to fresh U.S. threats of tougher sanctions, some senior officials in Tehran believe the door to diplomacy should stay open.
On Monday, U.S. Secretary
continuation:
of State Mike Pompeo said Washington would reimpose sanctions on Iran unless it gave up its nuclear program and stopped supporting militant groups in the Middle East.
Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif responded with a tweet: We are ready for talks. But we will not negotiate over our nuclear program.
The United States withdrew from a 2015 deal between Iran and world powers under which Tehran agreed to curb its uranium enrichment activities in exchange for the lifting of most international sanctions.
Washington has since reimposed sanctions that had been lifted as part of the deal, targeting Irans vital oil industry and financial sector.
But Iranian President Hassan Rouhani, who is seeking re-election next month, has repeatedly called for dialogue to ease tensions.
In an interview with state television aired on Tuesday, Zarif said Iran was willing to talk about other issues too, including regional security.
I think there is a lot of room for negotiation, he said.
If you look at the history of the region, there have been many occasions when countries have come together to solve their problems through negotiations, he said.
So I am optimistic that this can be done again.

input: Eastern Michigans offense picked up where it left off against Spring Arbor, scoring six of the first eight points in their match up against U of M-D forcing the visiting Wolverines into an early timeout. Easterns defense relied heavily

After a scoreless first quarter, EMU took control of the game with a 21-7 lead at the half. The Eagles continued to pour it on in the second half, outscoring the Wolverines 42-10 over the final 20 minutes to win by a final score of 65-48.

EMUs leading scorer was junior guard Jordan Moore who scored a game high 26 points. Senior guard Jevon Carter added 17 points and senior forward Matt McQuaid chipped in with 12 points and seven rebounds.

I think we did a good job of taking what they were giving us, said head coach John Beilein. We had a lot of guys step up and make big plays. We didnt have our best shooting night, but I thought we played well overall.

The win improves the Eagles record to 9-4 on the season and 3-2 in the Mid-American Conference (MAC) while the loss drops the Wolverines to 4-9 on the season and 1-3 in the MAC.

PARIS  Justin Thomas discovered just how tough Le Golf National will

I think its one of the hardest golf courses that Ive ever played, Thomas said. The fairways are really narrow. You have to hit a lot of driver off the tee, but you also have to hit a lot of irons as well. And then if you miss the green, youre not going to make many putts. So its definitely one of the toughest courses that Ive ever played.

Fleetwood made seven birdies and an eagle on the front nine, while Hovland birdied three of his last four holes.

input:
FILE - Afghan security forces stand guard at site of suicide car bombing attack in Kabul, May 19, 2015.
Afghanistan's parliament rejected a second nominee for defense minister on Saturday, leaving a vacuum that has already lasted nine months, while government
continuation:
officials say the Taliban have stepped up attacks across the country.
Parliament voted to reject Mohammad Hanif Atmar, who was nominated by President Ashraf Ghani last week, and replace him with Abdul Rahim Wardak, an army general who had been serving as deputy defense minister.
The vote came after Atmar said he would resign from his post, citing "personal reasons," without elaborating.
Atmar was one of three candidates vying for the position, which is considered the most important cabinet post in Afghanistan.
His withdrawal comes just days after U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry visited Kabul, where he held talks with Ghani and other leaders about the future of the war-ravaged country.
Kerry said the United States and its allies were committed to working with all sides to try to find a political solution to the conflict.
"We will not leave Afghanistan until we achieve that goal," he said in a statement.
Ghani, who took office in mid-2014, has promised to end the 18-year-old war and bring peace to the country.
But progress has been slower than expected, partly because of deep mistrust between the Afghan government and the Taliban, which controls or holds sway

We believe that the best ideas can come from anywhere and we are looking forward to seeing how these early-stage startups develop into successful businesses.

Google has been investing heavily in the Indian startup ecosystem in recent years. In 2016, it invested $150 million in eight startups across categories such as artificial intelligence (AI), Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, cloud computing, data science, mobile payments, and video streaming.

Earlier this year, Google announced its plan to invest $1 billion over the next five years in the Indian startup ecosystem. The company also launched a new incubator in Bengaluru earlier this year called Google Launchpad.

This is another step towards our goal of building a world-class innovation ecosystem in India, said Gautam

This notion
continuation:
has been disproven many times over in the past few years.
I'm not saying it hasn't, I'm just pointing out that it's not as common as people make it out to be.
I think it's more common than people make it out to be.  There are a lot of QBs in this league who can't get on the field for some reason or another.
That's why I said it's not as common as people make it out to be. It's certainly not unheard of, but it doesn't happen very often.
It happens all the time.  Just because you don't hear about it doesn't mean it doesn't happen.  The fact is, there are a lot of QBs who can't get on the field for some reason or another.  If you want to say that they're not good enough, then fine.  But if you want to say that they're not good enough *because* they can't get on the field, then that's a different story.

input: I remember the first interview I did about the gender pay gap, back in the 90s, when women had their very own Equal Opportunities Commission. We talked about pay rates reaching parity in full-time work, then getting dragged down by part-
continuation:
timers and casual workers. It was a long way from where we are now.

But theres a lot of progress to be made. A new report by the Institute for Public Policy Research (IPPR) has found that women still earn less than men at every level of employment, including those who have been working in the same job for 20 years or more.

This is despite the fact that women make up nearly half of the UK workforce.

The IPPR report, published on Wednesday, says: Women continue to be paid less than men at all levels of employment. The gap between male and female earnings has narrowed over the last decade, but it remains wide.

It shows that the average hourly wage for men aged 25 to 34 is 9.20, compared with 8.70 for women. In contrast, the average hourly wage for women aged 25 to 34 is 7.30, compared with 6.40 for men.

There are some bright spots, though. The average hourly wage for men aged 25 to 34 is 10.60, while the average hourly wage for women aged 25 to 34 is 8.50.

input: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Ra Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (NASDAQ:RARX) today announced that the design of its Phase 2 clinical trial of RA101495 SC for the treatment of generalized my
continuation:
asthenia gravis (GMG) has been accepted by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA). The trial will be conducted as a single-arm, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to evaluate the safety and tolerability of RA101495 SC in patients with GMG.

We are pleased to have received FDA approval for our Phase 2 clinical trial of RA101495 SC for the treatment of generalized myasthenia gravis (GMG), said David A. Cohen, Ph.D., Chief Executive Officer of Ra Pharmaceuticals. We look forward to starting this study in the first quarter of 2013. This is an important milestone for RA101495 SC, which we believe has the potential to become a new treatment option for patients suffering from GMG.

About Generalized Myasthenia Gravis

Generalized myasthenia gravis is a rare neuromuscular disease characterized by progressive muscle weakness and fatigue. It affects approximately 1 in 10,000 people worldwide and is the most common form of muscular dystrophy. In the United States, it is the second leading cause of disability after spinal muscular atrophy (SMA).

input:
Former communications minister Faith Muthambi was not interested in serving South Africans and "wanted to steal" at all cost, the commission of inquiry into state capture heard on Monday.
Acting Government Communication and Information System (GCIS) CEO
continuation:
Sipho Hlomuka told the commission that he had been approached by a number of people who wanted to work for the department, but were turned down.
Muthambi resigned from Cabinet last year after it emerged she had accepted a R1.4-million bribe from businessman Thulani Ngcukaitobi.
She is facing charges of fraud, corruption and money laundering relating to her alleged role in the awarding of tenders worth millions of rands to companies linked to the Guptas.
In his testimony, Hlomuka said Muthambi was one of the first people he met when he took up his position as GCIS chief executive officer in January 2016.
He said Muthambi came to him with a request to be appointed as head of the department's public relations unit.
"She asked me if I would consider appointing her as head of the Public Relations Unit of the Department of Communications," Hlomuka said.
Hlomuka said Muthambi was an experienced communicator who had worked in various media organisations, including the SABC, eNCA, SABC2 and SABC News.

input:
Will John Kelly Save Trumps Soul?
There hasnt been much good to say about Trump in a long time, but recruiting Kelly suggests that he learns, very belatedly, from his mistakes, and that he
continuation:
ll be a better president than the one we have now.
John Kelly, President Donald Trump's former chief of staff, has emerged as a leading contender for the top job at the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), according to two people familiar with the matter.
The White House did not immediately respond to a request for comment. A DHS spokesman declined to comment.
Kelly's name had been floated as a potential replacement for Kirstjen Nielsen after she was forced out of her post earlier this year. He also served as secretary of homeland security under President George W. Bush.
But sources told NBC News on Tuesday that Kelly is expected to be nominated by Trump to replace Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, who announced last week that he would be leaving the administration early next year.
Pompeo's departure will leave the department without a full-time leader for the first time since it was established in 2002. The department oversees the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and Customs and Border Protection (CBP) law enforcement agencies.
A source familiar with the matter told NBC News that Kelly is expected to be nominated by Trump to replace Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, who announced last week that he would be

input:
Drivers navigate Main at Mill streets in downtown Grass Valley following Monday morning's snow showers which dropped between 6 and 12 inches of snow in places.
Much of Nevada County lived up to its name today when folks awoke to a wintry wonderland
continuation:
.
The National Weather Service issued a winter storm warning for the area until 11:30 p.m., with up to 2 feet of snow expected to fall in some areas. The weather service also warned that winds could gust as high as 60 mph, making it feel like 40 or 50 degrees.
Snowfall totals ranged from 6 to 12 inches in Grass Valley, where the heaviest snow fell in the early morning hours, according to the National Weather Service.
In the foothills, about 4 inches of snow was reported on Mount Shasta, while just over an inch was recorded in the Sierra Foothills, according to the National Weather Service.
"We had a lot more snow than we thought we were going to get this year," NWS meteorologist Scott McLean said. "This is the first time we've ever gotten this much snow in January."
McLean said the snow started falling around 5:30 a.m. and continued through most of the day.
"It was pretty intense," McLean said. "We got a lot of reports of downed trees and power lines."
He added that the snow was heavy enough to cause traffic problems throughout the region.

input: Coming off a round of summer campaigning with Bloc Qubcois chief Gilles Duceppe, Parti Qubcois Leader Pierre Karl Pladeau said Tuesday an independent Quebec would demand its share of federal assets
continuation:
including the Trans Mountain pipeline expansion project.

We want to make sure that we get what we need from Ottawa, he told reporters in Trois-Rivires. Thats why I think its very important for Quebec to have a say in this process.

The PQ leader was asked about comments made by Prime Minister Justin Trudeau over the weekend during a visit to the United States, where he called on Alberta Premier Rachel Notley and British Columbia Premier John Horgan to work together to find a solution to the ongoing dispute between the two provinces.

Pladeau noted that Alberta is the largest oil producer in the country, while B.C. produces more natural gas than any other province.

I dont know if theres going to be a solution to this problem, but at least its not just one province against another. Its Canada versus the rest of the world, he said.

Its a good sign when the prime minister is willing to sit down with the premiers and talk to them about how they can work together.

input:
No. 5 Stanford (24-5, 10-2 Pac-12) completed a three-game sweep of Washington (15-15, 5-10 Pac-12) with a 6-1 victory on Sunday.
Looking to avenge
continuation:
last years loss in Seattle, the Cardinal jumped out to an early 2-0 lead and never looked back en route to their second straight win over the Huskies.
Stanford opened the scoring in the first inning on a solo home run from junior centerfielder Kole Calhoun, his team-leading 23rd of the season.
The Cardinal added two more runs in the third inning to extend their lead to 4-0. Sophomore shortstop Alex Yastrzemski led off with a single and moved to second on a wild pitch. After senior right fielder Max Stassi was hit by a pitch to load the bases, Calhoun drove a 1-0 pitch over the left field fence for his 12th home run of the season.
In the fourth inning, sophomore right-hander Eric Lauer (7-3) struck out seven batters and allowed just four hits in six innings pitched. He also walked one and did not allow a baserunner until the top of the sixth inning.
After a scoreless seventh inning, the Huskies were able to get on the board in the bottom of the eighth inning. Junior catcher Jake Hager led off the inning with a double and scored on a

input:
There is a hearing today on whether presidents should be required to make their tax returns public.
Rep. Richard Neal, D-Mass., then incoming chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, addressed an audience, Nov. 27, during a gathering
continuation:
at the National Constitution Center in Philadelphia. (AP Photo/Matt Slocum)
WASHINGTON  President Donald Trumps refusal to release his tax returns has prompted calls from Democrats for Congress to pass legislation requiring that he do so.
But theres little chance that will happen anytime soon.
Lawmakers have been trying unsuccessfully for more than two years to get the Internal Revenue Service to turn over Trumps tax returns to the House Ways and Means Committee, which is chaired by Rep. Richard Neal of Massachusetts, the top Democrat on the panel.
Neal is expected to introduce legislation this week that would require presidential candidates to release their tax returns before the November 2020 election. The bill, if it becomes law, would apply to any future candidate who wants to run for president.
Its unclear how much support the measure has in the Republican-controlled House or Senate. And even if it passes both chambers, its not clear whether Trump would sign it into law.
Here are some questions and answers about the issue:
___
WHAT IS THE REASON TRUMP HAS NOT RELEASED HIS TAX RETURNS?
Trump has refused to release his tax returns because they are under audit.

input:
KISSIMMEE, Fla. (WSVN)  A Vietnam War veteran passed away before he was able to be reunited with his beloved stolen service dog.
According to Fox 35, 67-year-old Joseph Hanson was walking last
continuation:
week in the parking lot of a Publix grocery store in Kissimmee, Florida, when he was approached by a man who asked him if he could help him find his missing dog.
Hanson said that he had been searching for the dog since it was taken from him more than two years ago.
Im not going to lie to you, I didnt know what to do, Hanson told Fox 35. I just wanted to go home and get some sleep, but at the same time, I felt like I had to help this guy.
Hanson went on to say that he took the mans phone number and called him the next day.
He said, Im sorry, I cant help you,' Hanson recalled. I said, Why not? Im looking for my dog.'
Hanson said that the man offered to take him to the area where the dog was last seen.
When we got there, we found nothing, Hanson said. We looked all over. We looked under cars. We looked

input:
San Francisco Giants pitcher Madison Bumgarner poses for photographers during photo day at spring training Wednesday, Feb. 20, 2013, in Scottsdale, Ariz.
Gregor Blanco #7 poses for a portrait during San Francisco Giants Photo
continuation:
Day at Scottsdale Stadium on Wednesday, February 20, 2013. (Photo by Mark J. Rebilas/Bay Area News Group)

SAN FRANCISCO - The San Francisco Giants have signed free agent right-hander Madison Bumgarner to a one-year contract worth $12 million, a person familiar with the negotiations told The Associated Press on Thursday.

The person spoke on condition of anonymity because the agreement had not been announced.

Bumgarner is coming off an injury-plagued season that saw him miss more than two months after having Tommy John surgery on his right elbow. He went 2-4 with a 5.40 ERA in 10 starts and 15 relief appearances last year.

"He's going to be a big part of our pitching staff," general manager Bobby Evans said. "We're very excited about him."

Evans declined to say how much money Bumgarner would earn this year, but he said the deal was done before the start of Spring Training.

"I can't tell you exactly what we paid him, but it was a lot less than what other teams were willing to pay," he said.

input: TAPACHULA, Mexico (AP)  Thousands of Central American migrants resumed an arduous trek toward the U.S. border Monday, with members bristling at suggestions there could be terrorists among them and saying the caravan is being used for
continuation:
political gain by President Donald Trump.

We dont know if they are terrorists or not, but what we know is that they want to enter the United States, said a Guatemalan migrant who gave his name only as Rafael because he feared reprisals against his family back home in Guatemala.

Trump has threatened to cut off aid to Honduras, Guatemala and El Salvador unless they do more to stop migrants from leaving their homelands to seek asylum in the U.S.

ADVERTISEMENT

On Sunday night, thousands of Hondurans, Guatemalans and Salvadorans began making their way through southern Mexico on foot after crossing the Suchiate River into Chiapas state from Guatemala.

Mexican security forces have been deployed along the route to prevent migrants from entering the country illegally. The Mexican government says it has no plans to send its own troops to the border.

But some migrants said they were concerned about the possibility of violence.

Im very scared, Ive never seen anything like this in my life. Were going to get killed, Rafael said.

input:
Valejah Savon Johnson's argument with Robert Mayes resulted in Mayes clinging to the hood of Johnson's speeding pickup truck, according to affidavit.
LAFAYETTE Twenty-one-year-old Valejah Savon Johnson
continuation:
is facing a felony charge after police say she was caught on video driving recklessly and causing a crash that injured another motorist.
The incident occurred at about 3:45 p.m. Sunday when Lafayette police officers were called to the intersection of West Third Street and East Seventh Avenue for a reported traffic accident.
Officers arrived to find two vehicles had collided head-on. The driver of the other vehicle was taken to a local hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.
According to court documents, Johnson fled the scene but was later arrested by Lafayette police. She was booked into the Terrebonne Parish Detention Center on charges of aggravated vehicular homicide, reckless operation of a vehicle, failure to yield right of way, driving under suspension and possession of drug paraphernalia. Her bail has been set at $150,000.
Johnson is scheduled to appear in court Tuesday morning.

input:
A Blackpool tattooist has been announced as one of the stars of a brand new MTV show.
Danny Robinson, 24, will be one of six tattoo artists to feature in the upcoming series Just Tattoo of Us.
continuation:
The show is set to air on MTV later this year.
MTV said: "We're thrilled to announce that Danny Robinson from Blackpool will be taking part in the first ever 'Just Tattoo Of Us' alongside some of the UK's best tattoo artists.
"It's an amazing opportunity for Danny and we can't wait to see what he comes up with next!"
Danny, who works out of The Ink Factory in Blackpool, said: "I'm absolutely over the moon to have been asked to take part in the first ever 'Just Tattoo Of Us'.
"It's going to be an incredible experience and I'm looking forward to getting my hands dirty."
He added: "Tattoos are all about personal expression so it's great to be able to work with such a talented group of people.
"I'm really looking forward to working with these guys and learning from them.
"It's going to be a real eye-opener for me and I can't wait to get started!
"I've always had a passion for tattoos but never thought it would be something I could actually do.
"Now I can't wait to show everyone just how much I love the art form

input: UPPER EAST SIDE  The Second Avenue subway blast that sprayed debris high into the air above 72nd street was sparked by an underground explosion the force of which hit a steel plate covering the work site at street level, the MTA revealed Wednesday.
continuation:
MTA officials said they were still trying to figure out exactly what caused Tuesdays explosion, which sent a plume of black smoke billowing into the sky and injured more than two dozen people.

We dont know for sure, but we suspect it may have been some kind of mechanical failure, MTA Chairman Pat Foye told reporters. Were going to do everything we can to make sure this doesnt happen again.

The blast occurred just before 6 p.m. near the intersection of Second Avenue and 72nd Street in the Upper East Side.

Foye said he had spoken with Mayor Bill de Blasio about the incident.

I want to thank the mayor for his quick response and his efforts to get to the scene as quickly as possible, Foye said. We are working closely with our police and fire department partners to determine the cause of the explosion.

He added: This is a very sad day for the city of New York. We will not forget those who lost their lives or suffered serious injuries. Our thoughts and prayers are with their families

input:
GREENSBURG, Ind. An Indiana man is facing a murder charge after allegedly admitting to killing his girlfriend.
Jason Eaton, 43, walked into the Greensburg Police Department on Tuesday with a woman and asked to talk to an officer. He
continuation:
told officers that he had killed his girlfriend, who was later identified as 33-year-old Jessica Luellen.
Eaton was taken into custody without incident.
Luellens body was found in a wooded area near the intersection of State Road 441 and East Main Street just before 7 p.m. Monday. Her death was ruled a homicide by strangulation.
The investigation is ongoing.
Anyone with information about this case is asked to call the Greensburg Police Department at (812) 543-3100 or Crime Stoppers of Central Indiana at (317) 262-TIPS (8477). Tipsters can remain anonymous and could be eligible for a reward of up to $1,000 if their tip leads to an arrest.
This story has been updated with additional information from Greenbrier police.

input:
Katy Perry will hit the MTV Video Music Awards stage later this month to perform her newly leaked single Roar.
Perry hasnt performed on the VMAs since 2009, but her new single is getting amazing feedback from fans.
continuation:
The song has already racked up more than 1.5 million views on YouTube in just a few days.
Visit Insiders homepage for more stories.
Katy Perry is set to make her long-awaited return to the MTV Video Music Awards stage later this month.
The pop star will perform her new single Roar at the annual awards show, which airs live August 27 at 8 p.m. ET/PT on MTV. The performance will be Perrys first appearance at the VMAs since 2009, when she took home the award for Best New Artist.
Since then, Perry has released several singles and music videos that have been met with critical acclaim. Her most recent album, Witness, was certified platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) for sales of over 2 million copies in the US alone. She also scored two Grammy Award nominations last year: Best Pop Vocal Album and Best Pop Collaboration with Vocals for her collaboration with Justin Bieber on Never Worn White.
Her latest single, Roar, is currently garnering rave reviews from fans who are calling it one of the best songs of 2020 so far.

input:
Just in time for Paris Fashion Week, the Italian design house Emilio Cavallini has apparently hit a nerve with its new unisex pantyhose designed for men, which has been dubbed "mantyhose."
At a price
continuation:
point of $69.99 (about 50), these high-waisted pantyhose come in three different colors: black, white and red.
The brand's founder, Emilio Cavallini, told The New York Times that he wanted to create a product that would appeal to both men and women.
"I think it is very important to have a product that can be used by both sexes," he said.
Cavallini, who was born in Italy but moved to the United States when he was 10 years old, said his inspiration came from his own experiences growing up as a gay man in the 1980s and '90s.
"It was not easy for me to find my place in the world," he said. "I felt like I didn't fit in anywhere."
He added, "I had no idea what I wanted to do or where I wanted to go. And then one day I went into a store and I saw a pair of pantyhose that were made for women. I thought, 'What am I doing here? What am I doing with my life?'"
Cavallini decided to launch his own line of pantyhose after being inspired by the
