input: NAFTA's environmental watchdog voted unanimously not to investigate oil sands tailings ponds pollution, despite recommendations from staff to launch a probe. It's the third time a NAFTA probe has been blocked by the Canadian government, pending a decision on Canada's controversial
continuation:
Keystone XL pipeline.

The National Energy Board (NEB) said in a report released Thursday that it couldn't find enough evidence to support an investigation into the potential impact of oilsands tailings ponds on the Great Lakes and St. Lawrence River systems.

"It is clear that the NEB does not have sufficient information to make a determination as to whether there would be any adverse impacts to the Great Lakes and St. Lawrence River system," the NEB said in its report.

Story continues below advertisement

But Environment Minister Leona Aglukkaq told reporters at a news conference she was disappointed with the NEB's decision.

"We are going to take this matter very seriously and we are going to work with our partners across the country to make sure that we do everything we can to ensure that these issues are addressed," Ms. Aglukkaq said. "I think it's important for Canadians to know that we're taking this very seriously."

Ms. Aglukkaq's office did not immediately respond to a request for further comment.

input:
Dinshaw Billimoria and Sulochana in Ardeshir Iranis Heer Ranjha made in 1929. Photo: Courtesy Donnabelle Garga.
India might be celebrating the centenary of cinema this year,
continuation:
but it has been a long time since we have had a new film from the country that is worth talking about. While there have been a number of films that have come out over the last few years, none of them have been as good as Dinshaw Billimoria's Heer Ranjha (1929).
Directed by Dilip Kumar, Heer Ranjha was one of the first Hindi films to feature an all-star cast. It also marked the debut of actor Sulochana in Bollywood.
The film stars Raj Kapoor, Madhubala, Meena Kumari, Saira Banu, Lata Mangeshkar, Shammi Kapoor, Nargis Fakhri, Anil Dhawan, Prakash Mehrotra and Kishore Kumar.
It tells the story of a woman who falls in love with a man she meets at a train station. The two get married and live happily ever after. However, things take a turn for the worse when her husband leaves her for another woman. The film ends on a cliffhanger, leaving audiences wondering what will happen next.
Here are five reasons why you should watch Heer Ranjha.

input:
A RADICAL shake-up, including a new school in Basingstoke, may be necessary to combat poor exam results, the deputy leader of the borough council believes.
Councillor Ranil Jayawardena says too many children in
continuation:
the borough are failing their GCSEs and A-levels, which is why he wants to see an overhaul of the education system.
He said: We need to look at what were doing in terms of the curriculum, how were preparing our young people for the future.
Cllr Jayawardena, who also serves as cabinet member for health and social care, was speaking after figures revealed that more than half (56 per cent) of students in Basingstoke and Deane failed their exams this year.
The figure is up from 47 per cent in 2015/16 and 44 per cent in 2014/15.
It comes amid growing concern about the state of the countrys schools.
Last month, Ofsted chief inspector Amanda Spielman said she was deeply concerned by the number of pupils who were falling behind in their studies.
In her annual report, Ms Spielman said the situation had worsened over the past two years.
She added: Pupils progress has not kept pace with the rising cost of living or the increasing pressure on family finances.

input:
Catholic Charities Southern Maryland Food Bank says it is in desperate need of pasta, rice, canned food and other dry goods.
A food bank in Southern Maryland that supplies many smaller food pantries and charities was gratified to get some donations following a
continuation:
devastating storm last week.
The Catholic Charities Southern Maryland Food Bank said it has been inundated with requests for items such as pasta, rice, canned food and peanut butter.
Weve never seen anything like this before, the agency said on its Facebook page. We are so grateful to all those who have reached out to help us during this difficult time. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.
The Baltimore Sun reported that the agency had received more than 1,000 phone calls, emails and text messages over the past three days.
In addition to pasta, rice and canned food, the agency also needs toilet paper, paper towels, baby wipes, deodorant, hand sanitizer, disinfectant wipes, dish soap, laundry detergent, paper towels, paper plates, napkins, paper cups, disposable razors, toothbrushes, toothpaste, shaving cream, body lotion, shampoo, conditioner, deodorant, deodorant sticks, deodorant sprays, antiperspirants, deodorant gels, antiseptic creams, antiseptic lotions, antiseptic ointment, antiseptic lotion

input: The vast majority of the 45 Amazon.com customers who have reviewed Bloomberg Businessweek writer Brad Stones new book, The Everything Store: Jeff Bezos and the Age of Amazon, gave it five stars. Lone among them, however, is a
continuation:
former employee who says he was fired for insubordination after complaining about the companys treatment of employees.

Stone, whose previous books include The Death and Life of Great American Companies (2007) and The Rise and Fall of the American Empire (2011), has been writing about Amazon since 2005. His latest book is based on his reporting from inside the company, which began in 1997 and has grown to become one of the worlds most valuable companies by market capitalization.

In an interview with The New York Times, Stone said that he decided to write the book because he wanted to expose what he saw as Amazons abuses of power.

I think theres a lot more going on here than were seeing, Stone told the newspaper. I dont know if Ive ever seen anything quite like this.

Amazon did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

input:
A new album is set for release later this year.
TLC have announced their first ever UK show, taking to Londons Koko on May 9. Tickets will be on sale this Friday (March 24).
Since the death of
continuation:
lead singer Toni Braxton in 2011, the group has released two studio albums and a handful of EPs. Their last full-length album, The Truth About Love, came out in 2013.
In a statement, the band said: We are so excited to announce that we will be returning to the UK with a brand new tour! We can't wait to see you all there!
Tickets go on sale at 10am tomorrow (March 23) via Ticketmaster.co.uk/tickets.
You can also buy tickets here.

Earlier this month, it was reported that the band were working on a follow-up to The Truth About Love.
Speaking to Rolling Stone about the possibility of another album, Braxton said: "I don't know if we're going to do one or not, but I'm definitely thinking about it."
"It's been a long time coming," she added. "I feel like we've done everything we wanted to do musically as far as music goes. It's just a matter of us getting back into the studio and putting something together."

input:
WASHINGTON  Republican David Yancey won a drawing to break a tie in the disputed 94th District race in Newport News Thursday however his opponent is expected to challenge the decision, possibly seeking yet another recount.
Control of the House of Delegates is
continuation:
up for grabs in Novembers midterm elections. Republicans currently hold a one-seat majority in the House and Democrats need to flip 24 seats to gain control of the chamber.
Yancey, an attorney and former Navy SEAL, defeated Democrat Danica Roem by just over 1,000 votes out of nearly 2.5 million cast in the district that includes Hampton Roads and parts of Virginia Beach and Norfolk.
Roem, who was the first openly transgender person elected to the U.S. House of Representatives, had challenged Yanceys victory on the grounds that he did not obtain enough valid signatures from registered voters to qualify for the ballot.
In a statement Thursday night, Yancey said I am confident we will be able to resolve this matter quickly and move forward with our mission of serving all Virginians.
Roems campaign issued a statement saying we are reviewing the courts order and considering next steps. We remain committed to ensuring every eligible voter has the opportunity to have their voice heard through the democratic process.
The Associated Press contributed to this report.
Like WTOP on Facebook and follow @WTOP on Twitter to engage in conversation

input: WASHINGTON  The professions expected to show one of the biggest job growth rates in 2017 and the largest growth in sheer number of jobs will be trade skills, according to a year-end report from CareerBuilder and labor market data provider Emsi.
continuation:
Trade is going to be a big driver for employment growth over the next several years, said Chris Rupkey, chief economist at MUFG Union Bank in New York. Its a sector thats growing faster than just about anything else.

The report, which was released on Wednesday, also showed that employers are looking to hire more people with education beyond high school or college.

Were starting to see an uptick in hiring of people with some sort of post-secondary training, said Michael Bernick, senior vice president of human resources at Home Depot Inc., who noted that the company plans to increase its workforce by 20 percent over the next three years.

Home Depots move comes as other retailers, including Target Corp., Wal-Mart Stores Inc. and Costco Wholesale Corp., have been expanding their workforces through higher pay and benefits.

In 2016, the U.S. unemployment rate ticked up to 4.7 percent, the highest in nearly five years. The Federal Reserve has kept interest rates near zero since late 2008, and many economists expect them to remain there for the foreseeable future.

input:
Noah Cyrus had no desire to follow her sister Miley Cyrus into a pop music as a child because she was so focused on becoming an equestrian.
In addition to acting in several TV shows, the 18-year-old star was
continuation:
also a horseback riding enthusiast and wanted to pursue a career in that field.
She said: I didnt know what I wanted to do with my life, but I knew I wanted to ride horses. My parents were very supportive of me doing it, and they always encouraged me to do whatever I wanted to do.
My mom would say, You can do anything you put your mind to. Thats kind of how I grew up. I never really thought about what I wanted to be when I grew up.
However, Noah is now considering following in her older sisters footsteps by pursuing a career in music.
Speaking to The Sun newspaper, she said: I dont know if Im going to be a singer or not, but I definitely want to be in the music business one day.
Miley, 27, has already made a name for herself in the music industry after releasing her debut solo single Wrecking Ball in 2008.
The song went on to become a global hit and helped her achieve fame and fortune.
Her second studio album, Bangerz, was released in 2010

TAIPEI (The China Post/ANN)  Taiwans top elected official visited the Taipei Songshan Fengtian Temple on Tuesday to pay his respects to Taoist deities.
Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen () and her husband, former president Ma Ying-jeou (), paid their respects to Taoist deities at the temple in the morning.
Afterward, they were joined by other dignitaries, including Deputy Prime Minister Hsu Kuo-yu (), Secretary for Culture, Sports and Tourism Chen Shih-chung (), and Taiwan Affairs Office Director-General Chiu Chui-cheng ().

input:
Cecil Brunsons life in the air  and the guile he showed in the Vietnam War  will be honored Saturday at the Tennessee Aviation Hall of Fame.
Growing up in Memphis, Lt. Col. Cecil Brunson only
continuation:
knew one thing about flying: He wanted to be a pilot. So when he graduated from high school, he enlisted in the U.S. Army Air Corps.
Brunson was just 19 years old when he flew his first combat mission during the Vietnam War.
I remember it like it was yesterday, Brunson said. We were bombing an area where there was a lot of enemy activity. It was very hot that day and we had to fly low to avoid being shot down.
He would go on to fly more than 1,000 missions in the skies over Southeast Asia before returning to Memphis.
In 1968, Brunson was awarded the Distinguished Flying Cross for his actions during the Tet Offensive. He was also awarded the Bronze Star Medal with Valor Device and the Purple Heart for injuries sustained in action.
After serving in the military, Brunson went on to earn a Bachelor of Science degree in aeronautical engineering from Memphis State University in 1972. He then earned a masters degree in business administration from the University of Tennessee-Knoxville in 1978.
Brunson started his career as an aircraft mechanic with the U.S. Air Force before joining the

input:
Thirty-four states  half with Republican governor  have seized upon the massive infusion of Medicaid expansion revenue.
Imagine an 18 wheeler pulling up to one of the five Mississippi River bridges and dumping 45 crates 4 feet tall and of $100 bills
continuation:
a total value of more than $1 million  on the pavement. Thats exactly what is happening across the country as state governments scramble to pay for expanded Medicaid under the Affordable Care Act, or Obamacare.
The result: The federal government has paid out more than $2 billion in reimbursement payments to states so far this year, according to the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS).
Thats a lot of money, but it pales in comparison to the $3.6 billion that the feds are expected to hand out over the next three years. In all, HHS expects to disburse more than $10 billion in reimbursements to states through 2016.
In fact, HHS officials say they expect the number of Medicaid enrollees to increase by more than 50% between now and 2016.
But how much will that cost taxpayers? A recent analysis from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office (CBO) estimates that the total cost of expanding Medicaid could be as high as $200 billion over the next decade, depending on how many people are added to the rolls.
Thats a lot of money, but it pales in comparison to the $

It's hard not to be charmed by his new perkier outlook on life.
Married life may have mellowed British wind-up merchant Example in recent years, but when you're a popstar it must be hard not to divulge
continuation:
too much information about your private life.
And that's exactly what he's done in an interview with The Guardian, where he reveals the details of how he met his wife and their four children.

'I'm so lucky': Example has opened up about how he met his wife (pictured) and their four children in an interview with The Guardian

The couple married last year in a secret ceremony in Los Angeles.
However, Example revealed that they were actually engaged for two years before getting hitched.
When asked if he had any advice for young people who might be considering tying the knot, Example said: 'Don't get married until you are absolutely sure you want to spend the rest of your life with this person.

input:
Pedro Gonzalez faces up to 48 years in prison for allegedly attempting to beat Dita Richterova to death.
Friends have set up a GoFundMe page for Dita Richterova, who was severely beaten during an attack at the Brush
continuation:
y Creek Apartments on Saturday night.
According to court documents obtained by ABC News, Pedro Gonzalez has pleaded not guilty to attempted first-degree murder and assault with intent to commit a felony.
Gonzalez is being held without bond.
The incident occurred just before 11:30 p.m., when officers responded to a report of a fight between two men in the parking lot of the apartment complex.
When police arrived, they found Dita lying on the ground with multiple lacerations to her head and face.
She was taken to a local hospital, where she was pronounced dead.
Police said that Gonzalez and another man were seen running away from the scene after the attack.
Gonzalez is scheduled to be arraigned on Monday.
